About Whistic
Whistic is on a mission to become the Vendor Security Network where buyers and sellers establish and maintain ongoing connections, enabling faster business decisions.

Here’s how it works: When a company is seeking out a vendor that will have access to its sensitive data, that company must assess the vendor to ensure it meets certain information security thresholds. This assessment process results in cumbersome, clunky, and slow spreadsheets emailed back and forth — eating up info security resources and ultimately delaying deals.

That’s where Whistic comes in. Our market-defining platform enables security and sales teams to proactively conduct and respond to third party security assessments by streamlining and automating the process, transforming the work for companies all over the world, saving professionals valuable time, and ultimately helping to safeguard sensitive information.

2023-03-09,"TalentBurst, an Inc 5000 company",Senior Data Analyst,United States,"Senior Data Analyst
12 Months+
100% Remote Role.

As a Data Analyst, you will play a key role in supporting our products and clients with performance reports that leverage unique data elements and deliver real insights. We are looking for a data-driven individual who can support the product team with building products and solutions, and IT team with data model building and build reports that translate complex data into user-friendly outputs and thrives in a fast-paced, ambiguous environment.
What you'll be doing

The Data Analyst's primary responsibility is to be focused on data analytics, data acquisition and business performance, which includes preparing reports/dashboards, gathering and analyzing data, ad-hoc analyses of data and product acquisition projects and proactive identification of actionable optimization opportunities.
The candidate will support the ECS teams by deeply understanding the data, permissions and structure. You will be responsible for building, maintaining, and innovating on data reports.
1. Gather requirements and produce ad hoc and recurring reports for internal teams and/or external clients.
2. Learn business perspective and product functionality and anticipate operational reporting and analytics needs.
3. Work closely with product owners, engineers and data architects to define non-functional requirements.
4. Assist business with KPI creation for baselining and subsequent monitoring of the established KPIs.
5. Write and own SQL code to pull structured and semi-structured data from Aurora Postgres, Snowflake, S3, and/or other solutions.
6. Utilize tools such as Alteryx and Snowflake to build tables/views to consolidate data
7. Select and use various visualization methods to communicate the story within the data.
8. Build reports and views with eye towards long term maintainability.
9. Present and demo reports and gather feedback.
10. Monitor behavior and performance of data vendor and customer systems over time.
11. Support on-demand raw data requests with appropriate business justification.
12. Collaborate with engineering to optimize reporting databases, find and fix cause of data anomalies, and support new and existing reports.
13. Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets using statistical techniques.
14. Work with management to prioritize business and information needs
15. Locate and define new process improvement opportunities
16. Identify and consult external data sources as appropriate.
17. Help maintain and manage departmental document repository (data dictionary, data lineage, metric definitions) ensuring up-to-date versions and correct document storage.
What your background looks like
1. Passionate and curious about data
2. Critical and logical thinker
3. Self-motivated
4. 5+ years of experience in Data Analyst or Business Data Analyst positions.
5. Comfortable with presenting data findings and demonstrating completed reports.
6. Broad understanding of data modeling methodologies such as relational (logical, physical), star schema, etc.
7. Skills and experience with data mining using SQL.
8. A four-year degree. Preferably in Computer Science, Information Management, Information Systems, Software Engineering, Mathematics, or a related analytical field
9. Experience in creating meaningful and easy to understand data reports, leveraging a Tableau or other Data Visualization tools.

10. Comfortable in the language of APIs including experience using JSON, Postman, reading swagger documentation and the general ability to work with other technical groups to understand how to query and retrieve data.
11. Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets.
12. Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
13. Strong organizational and time-management skills

Job Summary

The Arizona State Hospital (ASH) uses Tableau and other visual analytics as important tools for data visualization to enable data-driven decision-making in both hospital operations and improving direct patient care. Tableau dashboards have been used extensively to answer complicated business questions, share data with the public, provide up-to-date information to leadership and decision-makers, and share analyses and visualizations with oversight and partner agencies and entities. This position will work with program areas throughout the hospital to develop new, high-quality data infrastructure, views, and models that meet the needs of programs and leadership including
column2: Nursing, Medical, Quality, Compliance, Security, Informatics, Specialty Clinic, Training, and Education, Hospital Administration, and other groups. This position is responsible to:

This position may offer the ability to work remotely, within Arizona, based upon the department's business needs and continual meeting of expected performance measures.

The State of Arizona strives for a work culture that affords employees flexibility, autonomy, and trust. Across our many agencies, boards, and commissions, many State employees participate in the State’s Remote Work Program and are able to work remotely in their homes, in offices, and in hoteling spaces. All work, including remote work, should be performed within Arizona unless an exception is properly authorized in advance.

2023-07-28,Shell Energy,DATA QUALITY & CATALOGUING ANALYST,"Houston, TX","Description
At Shell Energy Solutions, we believe there’s a better way to power your business and home.

Aligned with Shell’s ambition to be a significant global power business and to become net zero by 2050, our cleaner, affordable and simple solutions help companies manage their energy spend and plan their sustainability roadmap - a fresh approach for environmentally conscious businesses that are looking to boost their sustainability credentials. We also have set out to deliver the very best experience to our customers across all our channels.

Shell Energy Solutions mission is delivering cleaner energy solutions for a brighter tomorrow by guiding customers toward a better energy future, enabling customer choice and by providing market-leading energy solutions.

Going above and beyond for our customers is what we’re all about and we have set out to deliver the very best experience to our customers across all our channels. But bigger challenges lie ahead, and we need to keep moving forward. Are you ready to help us get there?
WHERE YOU FIT IN

We are looking for a savvy Data Quality & Cataloguing Analyst to join our growing team of data platform experts. The hire will be responsible for aiding in our data maturity journey. The ideal candidate is an experienced data analyst and data wrangler who enjoys optimizing data systems and processes.

The Data Quality & Cataloguing Analyst will support our software developers, database architects, data engineers and data scientists on data initiatives and will ensure optimal organization and quality of data. They must be self-directed and comfortable supporting the data needs of multiple teams, systems and products. The right candidate will be excited by the prospect of solving complex problems, is driven to enable users to succeed, and can build effective stakeholder relationships.
Reporting into the Data Platform Manager, the role requires self-motivated, dedicated and responsible individual with the ability to perform well under pressure.
Job Duties & Responsibilities
Create and maintain data dictionaries and catalogs.
Interface with business stakeholders and leadership to understand and define data needs.
Analysis data quality via data profiling and build long term metrics with data profiling scorecards.
Assemble large, complex data sets that meet functional / non-functional business requirements.
Identify, design, and implement internal process improvements: automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, etc.
Work with stakeholders including the Executive, Product, Data and Design teams to assist with data-related technical issues and support their data needs.
Ensure data separated, accessible, and secure in accordance with relevant governance and compliance requirements.
Build data views and reports to expose and drive data insights.
Work with data and analytics experts to strive for greater functionality in our data systems.
Other duties as assigned
Essential Skills & Experience
Successful job applicants will be able to perform these functions. Reasonable accommodations will be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
5+ years of experience in a Data Analyst role.
Experience using the following software/tools:
Experience with data profiling and quality tools: Collibra, Informatica Data Quality/Analyst, Talend, etc.
Experience with data tools: Dremio (primary), Databricks, Spark, etc.
Experience with relational SQL and NoSQL databases, including MSSQL, Postgres, MongoDB, TimescaleDB, etc.
Experience with creation of Data Dictionaries/Catalogues
Experience creating reports in Power BI (primary), Tableau, etc.
Familiarity with data warehouse technologies: RedShift, SQL DW, Snowflake
Familiarity with Master Data Management principals.
Advanced working SQL knowledge and experience working with relational databases, query authoring (SQL) as well as working familiarity with a variety of databases.
Experience building and optimizing data pipelines and curated data queries.
Experience performing root cause analysis on internal and external data and processes to answer specific business questions and identify opportunities for improvement.
Build processes supporting data transformation, data structures, metadata, dependency and workload management.
A successful history of manipulating, processing and extracting value from large, disconnected datasets.
Working knowledge of message queuing, stream processing, and data lakes.

Be a proactive team player - we’re a small team with big ambitions in doing things at speed. As we work across a number of channels, projects, and conflicting priorities, being able to navigate and juggle multiple things on the go is required as well as being proactive enough to anticipate the next steps and actions.

Good communication skills, written and oral, for example ensuring sales agents are kept informed of any delays in turning around pricing requests, or outlining the rationale behind a decision not to approve credit for a customer.
Analytical mindset, demonstrate ability to problem solve and create practical solutions to overcome problems and mitigate risks.
Comfortable working in a target-driven and fast-changing environment, and able to respond to changing business needs
Excellent attention to detail
Proficient use of Microsoft Office programs including Word, Outlook and strong Excel skills
Excellent analytical, organization and time management skills, with the ability to maintain a strict level of attention to detail
Ability to work well within a team environment and demonstrate a vested interest in team goals and objectives
Excellent interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to establish and maintain positive and effective working relationships
Self-motivated with the desire to consistently improve performance and gain further knowledge
Ability to meet deadlines, learn quickly and demonstrate effective problem solving and follow-up skills
LOCATION & WORK SCHEDULE
Required to be in-person in The Woodlands/Houston, TX through a hybrid workplace environment

Competitive Compensation
Health Care - Medical/Dental/Vision/Prescription Drug Coverage
401(k) with Company Matching Contributions
Flexible Spending Accounts (FSA)
Health Savings Accounts (HSA)
Disability Programs (STD & LTD)
Employee Basic Term Life Insurance
Generous Vacation & Company Holidays

Training and coaching
Tuition Reimbursement

And much more!
SHELL ENERGY VALUES

Shell is a company with shared values. Honesty, integrity, and respect aren't simply a strapline: they are part of everything we do. What's more, Shell is an equal opportunities company, and we place the highest possible value on the diversity of our people and our inclusive approach. Join us and you’ll belong to a world where you are proud of your achievements and propel your career with global opportunities. We care deeply about fostering a truly diverse workplace.

Position Description

Under the supervision of the Director of Development, the Advancement System Analyst will assist and support the Advancement Office through enhancement and maintenance of data, recommend organizational and process improvements, and implement technical solutions that enhance the school’s ability to achieve its fundraising goals.

Position Responsibilities
Stewardship

Engages with and supports the Advancement team in a meaningful fundraising process by collaborating with team members to develop appropriate stewardship ideas and solicitation strategies for the organization’s donors and prospects
Oversees the proper and timely acknowledgement of donations
Systemizes touch points for prospects and donors in all phases of the fundraising cycle
Conducts background research on prospect donors and foundations in order to promote positive cultivation of these prospective donors

Serves as the operational liaison between the External Affairs Office and the Business Office by reconciling constituent and donation information, as well as identifying areas of process and efficiency improvement

Tracks and analyzes targeted donor solicitations to gain greater insight to achieve greater impact with subsequent mailings
Stays current with fundraising trends including, but not limited to, data management software, research methodologies, and stewardship best practices

Proficient power user and admin for all aspects of the CRM database, including: gift management, ensuring donors receive accurate gift acknowledgements, creating constituent queries for targeted list pulls, generating reports with the ability to analyze data and trends, and maintain communication notes with donors
Data/Analytical

Supports efforts to ensure that information systems uphold overall organizational mission and objectives by working directly with the External Affairs Office and IT to recommend, help prioritize, document, implement, and test donor data solutions

Examines and develops recommended CRM donor database procedures that enhance department workflow. On an ongoing basis, is responsible for updating these processes. Note: An example is creating an automated dashboard to monitor giving progress and trends
Partners with IT to learn the complexities of internal software systems and suggest improvements (Veracross) to aide in data integrity across teams

Works closely with Director of Development to create and maintain statistical reports, which include: gathering requirements, compiling data reporting items, analyzing data, making recommendations to measure fundraising, engagement and participation objectives
Provide data for annual reports detailing the impact of AIS’s work on its mission

Gathers, cleanses, records, and imports data from Veracross into Raiser's Edge, the donor CRM to ensure that information supports departmental objectives and information needs. Note: An example of this – Every year in Veracross, IT transfers prospective students and their families to currently enrolled along with families that are not returning to AIS as former. Having this information allows Advancement to see which families are new, returning or leaving AIS. Then, Advancement has to clean up donor records in Raiser’s Edge to reflect these changes.

Assists in staff training on crucial technical databases including Raiser’s Edge and Veracross and provides technical assistance. Trains appropriate staff in data entry standards, running basic queries and report generation, as needed.

Collaborates with the External Affairs Office to create and maintain donor stewardship documents that are clear and concise internal processes of communications with constituents, database workflows, and organizational processes
Other duties may be assigned in support of other leadership special initiatives and key duties
Knowledge, Skills, Abilities and/or Competencies:
Ability to develop and prepare donor case examples and predictive models for forecasting fundraising goals and outcomes
Ability to understand and represent the needs of the team in data reporting
Ability to analyze and present datasets in order to identify anomalies, patterns, errors, and potential areas for improvement
Ability to translate Advancement objectives into technical and data systems solutions

Ability to interact effectively verbally and in writing with internal and/or external technical and non-technical constituents, including skilled In writing and editing donor communications such as gift acknowledgements
Must have advanced knowledge of and ability to operate within Raiser’s Edge 7
Knowledgeable in following both the IRS regulations with regard to charitable giving and the Council in Support of Aid to Secondary Education (CASE) gift acceptance standards
column2: ability to manage all gift data and reporting to comply with these standards.

column1: Highly developed skills in the management of a robust donor database, including developing policies and protocols governing its operations and implementation.

Candidate must have advanced knowledge of Raiser’s Edge 7.
Candidate must have advanced computing skills including Microsoft Office Suite, especially Microsoft Excel.
Candidate must be able to multitask in a fast-paced work environment with special attention to planning, prioritizing, and meeting expectations as it relates to database projects.
Candidate must be able to work independently and as a member of a team.
Candidate must possess the drive, energy, flexibility, initiative, integrity, and sincere interest in finding different ways to be engaged in the Atlanta International School community.

Sr. Technical Analyst (this will be the internal CVS job title) Cloud Data Protection will be a key member of Zero Trust Network Access program and support Data Protection Services capabilities in ensuring the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of our organization's data by implementing and managing Cloud Access and Data Loss Protection (DLP) capabilities in Zero Trust platform. Design, deploy, and configure Access Controls for URLs and Cloud Apps, tenant profiles, cloud DLP and CASB controls for SaaS and IaaS to protect sensitive data from unauthorized access, leakage, and exfiltration and enforce compliance requirements.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including network administrators, security analysts, and system engineers, to integrate ZTNA data protection into the existing security infrastructure.
Conduct regular assessments and audits of access and DLP policies and rules to ensure their effectiveness and alignment with CVS Health and industry best practices.
Perform troubleshooting and issue resolution related to data protection, including investigating false positives and false negatives, and fine-tuning detection and prevention mechanisms.
Stay up-to-date with the latest trends, vulnerabilities, and attack vectors, and recommend appropriate countermeasures.
Provide technical expertise and guidance to other team members and stakeholders on Zero Trust functionality, implementation, and best practices.
Respond to security incidents/findings where data handling is not in line with policy, partner with others to perform root cause analysis and corrective actions.

Clinical Data Analyst-Clinical Data Operations- Hybrid

The Clinical Data Operations team at Mount Sinai Health System supports clinical departments, clinical centers of excellence and clinical institutes through the curation and stewardship of clinical data registries which lay the clinical data foundation to provide leadership and care teams with the data and insights they need for monitoring care processes, quality measurement and outcomes assessment.

Our team is seeking a Clinical Data Manager-Informaticist to help provide solutions to integrate, cleanse, govern and translate clinical data into comprehensive databases to meet the reporting needs for patient and disease cohorts. This job requires a detail-oriented clinical data manager with strong technical skills and strong knowledge of data quality assurance/data validation and data collection process/form design.
Responsibilities
In collaboration with clinical teams, determine data requirements as well as best data sources to meet data requirements.

Apply your knowledge of relational database design to document data requirements, define data sources and share findings with clinical data coordinator teams for data collection and with data engineering and analytics teams for extraction, transformation and loading of data in usable staging and analytic tables in our data warehouse.
Design Data Quality Assurance Processes
Design and build data collection processes per specifications/requirements.
Act as subject matter expert for database projects.
Perform data validation at various stages of data processing and report development to ensure complete and accurate data capture and reporting.
Respond to and resolve data quality issues.
Compile data summary reports, data profiles, patient lists and other data reports per ad hoc requests from internal and external teams.
Produce and manage data definition documents (DDDs).
Qualifications
Bachelor's degree required. Master’s degree in life science, informatics, population health, healthcare management or related field a plus.
Three (+) years of professional experience in clinical disease registries, population health, or in the medical device or pharmaceutical/biotechnology industry
Intermediate SQL skill
Strong Excel skills
CRF/database design experience
Experience working across multiple studies/projects across clinical areas simultaneously
Excellent organizational and time management skills
Independent worker who also contributes well to team initiatives
Demonstrated analytical skills and attention to detail
Excellent communication skills

EPIC/EPIC Clarity experience preferred
Redcap experience
R/SAS/Python programming experience is a plus
CDISC/CDASH experience preferred

With the Health & Insurance Benefits Division, you’ll be joining a passionate team of self-motivated change agents united by our mission: driving to design the delivery of high-quality healthcare for nearly three-quarters of a million active and retired Texas public educators.

column2: overseeing the work of vendors supporting the health plans
column3: and supporting the procurement and contracting of health care and related services. Works under limited supervision with considerable latitude for initiative and independent judgement. This position will proactively work with HIB staff, agency employees, and health care vendors.

column1: This a primarily remote position that will require the selected applicant to report to the TRS offices, located in Austin, TX, 1-2 times per quarter or as needed to meet business needs.

2023-07-10,Associated Grocers Baton Rouge,Business Data Research Analyst,Baton Rouge, LA","Job Details
Description

The Business Data Research Analyst is a professional who specializes in analyzing and interpreting complex data sets to extract insights, make informed business decisions, and identify, develop, and implement changes and improvements to processes, procedures, and systems associated with continuous improvement of business results, quality of service metrics, and operational performance. Their primary role is to collect, process, and analyze large volumes of structured and unstructured data across multiple departments using various techniques, algorithms, and analytics. The primary responsibility of the Analyst is to identify issues and concerns followed by specific recommendations, initially in the area of the Company’s Quality of Service to retail customers, expanded to other areas of prioritized concerns thereafter.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities include the following. Other duties may be assigned.

Data Collection and Cleaning: Gather QOS and related data from various sources, such as databases, business intelligence data, APIs, or external files. Clean and preprocess the data to ensure accuracy and remove any inconsistencies, anomalies, or errors.

Data Exploration and Visualization : Perform exploratory data analysis to identify patterns, trends, and relationships within the data. Verify the integrity and accuracy of the analyzed data, while utilizing data visualization techniques and tools to present findings in a clear and understandable manner.
Statistical Analysis: Apply statistical methods to derive insights from data, including but not limited to
column2: hypothesis testing, regression analysis, clustering and classification techniques to understand relationships, predict outcomes, and uncover hidden patterns.

column1: Preparation of Potential Solutions: Based upon the analyses performed, identify, and recommend actionable solutions and recommendations for improving the operational results of the analyzed data, including but not limited to the Quality of Service, and meaningfully reducing negative Quality of Service incidents, situations, and results with a goal of streamlining, simplifying, and overhauling the Company’s Customer Credit Policies.

Data-Driven Decision Making: Works closely with stakeholders, including but not limited to, Warehouse Operations, Sales & Marketing, Retail Operations, Finance & Accounting, Information Services, and Customer Service for understanding the dynamics and expectations of these entities for implementing solutions that will significantly enhance the Company’s performance.

Collaborative Teamwork: Ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams for collectively working on the necessary improvements and changes in managing, delivering, and measuring corporate improvement.

Continual Learning and Innovation: Stay up to date with the latest developments in data research, trend analysis, meta and micro data, and relevant technologies and methodologies. Continuous enhancement of skills and exploration of innovative approaches to solve complex problems and improve existing processes and systems.
Qualifications

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
Education And/or Experience & Special Skills

Bachelor's degree (B.A. or B.S.) from four-year college or university. Specific studies such as mathematics, statistics, computer science, engineering, supply chain, and/or economics preferred. 3-5 years of experience in data analytics, preferably in the distribution or logistics industry.
Language Skills

Ability to read, analyze and utilize technical terminology related to data science, statistics, and machine learning. This includes understanding and using terms such as regression, classification, clustering, algorithms, features, models, and evaluation metrics. Ability to effectively present findings to all levels of management, front-line supervisors, and all workforce positions. Ability to translate data analytics and findings into effective business cases for achieving Quality of Service improvements.
Mathematical Skills

A strong understanding of statistical concepts. This includes knowledge of probability theory, hypothesis testing, statistical inference, regression analysis, sampling techniques and experimental design. Familiarity with presenting mathematical and statistical findings to non-mathematical business decision makers.
Reasoning Ability

Ability to use analytical tools and techniques to extract meaningful insight from data. Ability to be adept at defining problem statements, formulating hypotheses, designing experiments, and evaluating alternative approaches to arrive at effective solutions. Ability to apply logical reasoning to identify the root causes of problems and devise appropriate strategies to address them. Ability to employ inductive reasoning to draw general conclusions from specific observations or data patterns. Ability to utilize deductive reasoning to derive specific implications or predictions from general principles or models. Ability to recognize meaningful patterns, outliers, or anomalies that may provide valuable insights.
Computer Skills

To perform this job successfully, an individual should have advanced skills in all Microsoft applications. Must be comfortable learning new technologies including business intelligence tools, databases, and operational management software.
Other Skills And Abilities
Communication and presentation skills
Problem framing and solutions design
Must be able to work well with others and build relationships throughout the operations of the business to ensure measurable results.
Physical Demands

The Business Intelligence (BI) Architect is a senior level position on the SAP Business Intelligence Team (BI) within the Global Corporate Information Technology. 2023-07-22,California Polytechnic State University-San Luis Obispo,Data Analyst (530344),"San Luis Obispo, CA","Description
Job Summary

Under the general supervision of the Executive Director for Institutional Research and working collaboratively within the IR Team and with Teams from other units, the Associate, Academic and Institutional Studies II (Data Analyst) undertakes studies of considerable scope and complexity including recognizing side issues or related problems for further inquiry and for recommending lines of approach to incorporate them into the main study or to pursue them through a separate project. Long-range and continuing studies are reported periodically and changes in direction or focus, as required by changing circumstances, are cleared with the supervisor. In addition, the incumbent provides support to the different functions of IR as needed.

Institutional Research focuses on providing decision support in areas related to planning, policy development, and institutional effectiveness, among other and generally addresses mandated reporting, data and research requests, and external surveys. Conducting analytical studies may include determining project methods and design, data collection, web-based surveys, an emphasis on quantitative data analysis, interpreting and drawing conclusions from the findings and preparing presentations and other materials to disseminate the findings in such a way that they will be useful for decision-making and institutional improvement.
This position may be eligible to be remote according to Cal Poly’s Telecommuting and Remote Work Guidelines.
Department Summary

The scope of Institutional Research (IR) includes establishing baseline data, fulfilling mandated reporting, preparing analytical reports, and supplying data and analysis to support decision making and University planning. IR, as an interpretive and analytical user of data, works collaboratively with other campus units for data accuracy. The analytical component involves designing, developing, and completing interpretative studies as well as the timely provision of accurate, current, and relevant institutional data to the Cal Poly campus community, the California State University system, and other interested parties.
Key Qualifications
Working knowledge of data warehouse systems, data programming, and data management.
Demonstrated skills in analyzing large complex databases. Ability to independently identify and resolve data conflicts.
Demonstrated ability to use database query languages and tools to retrieve, examine, evaluate, combine, and manipulate data from multiple sources.
Experience with version control and unit testing.

Ability to obtain necessary information for different projects as requested, ability to analyze the information, draw conclusions and develop recommendations, prepare written reports, and lead meetings and negotiations.
Education And Experience

Bachelor’s Degree from a four-year college or university in a field or discipline that included emphasis on research methods and statistical or quantitative analysis. Four years of progressively responsible administrative, technical, or professional analytical experience which demonstrates ability to conduct statistical studies of problems and issues in assigned areas OR the rank of Associate Professor or higher in a four-year college or university and demonstrated experience in research or special study work may substitute for the four years of experience.
Salary And Benefits
Anticipated Hiring Range: $72,000 - $89,000 per year
Classification Range: $68,376 - $123,708 per year

Cal Poly offers a best-in-class benefits program, including health, dental and vision insurance, retirement participation in the Public Employees' Retirement System, and educational benefits for eligible employees. See our benefits website for additional information.
Cal Poly

Cal Poly is a nationally-ranked public university located in San Luis Obispo, California, and known for its Learn by Doing philosophy. Each year more than 20,000 top-tier students come to San Luis Obispo to put knowledge into action, taking their learning outside the classroom as they prepare for careers in engineering, agriculture, science, business, humanities and the built environment. Cal Poly’s hands-on philosophy, small class sizes and close student-faculty mentorships result in graduates ready from day one to impact their communities, California and the world. For more information, visit calpoly.edu.
Diversity Statement

At Cal Poly, we believe that cultivating an environment that embraces and promotes diversity is fundamental to the success of our students, our employees and our community. Bringing people together from different backgrounds, experiences and value systems fosters the innovative and creative thinking that exemplifies Cal Poly's values of free inquiry, cultural and intellectual diversity, mutual respect, civic engagement, and social and environmental responsibility.
Cal Poly's commitment to diversity informs our efforts in recruitment, hiring and retention. Cal Poly is an equal opportunity employer.
Supplemental Information

CSU requires faculty, staff, and students who are accessing campus facilities to be immunized against COVID-19 or declare a medical or religious exemption from doing so. Any candidates advanced in a currently open search process should be prepared to comply with this requirement. Current employees who are offered positions on campus will be required to undergo a background check for any position where a background check is required by law or that Cal Poly has designated as sensitive.

The person holding this position is considered a 'mandated reporter' under the California Child Abuse and Neglect Reporting Act and is required to comply with the requirements set forth in CSU Executive Order 1083 as a condition of employment.

2023-07-20,Stanford University,Research Data Analyst 2,"Stanford, CA","The Division of Cardiovascular Medicine is a dynamic and innovative center dedicated to excellence in research, medical education, and clinical care. Our division is driven by over 80 faculty, clinician educators and instructors who are the pillar of strength in the Division's ongoing efforts into the prevention and treatment of cardiovascular disease.

The Computational Arrhythmia Research laboratory works at the intersection of bioengineering, data science and cardiac electrophysiology (heart rhythm disorders). Our goal is to use detailed data from patients to better understand disease mechanisms, particularly for atrial fibrillation and ventricular tachycardia, and use computational models, machine learning and other tools to develop improved diagnostic and treatment tools.

We are currently seeking a highly skilled and motivated Research Data Analyst 2 to join our team. The ideal applicant will have experience in coding in python and other languages in the fields of artificial intelligence (AI), machine learning (ML) and natural language processing (NLP) of electronic health records (EHR) data. The Research Data Analyst will use NLP to process and analyze diverse data sources, including de-identified clinical records, for clinically relevant medical issues in patients with heart rhythm disorders. The applicant should be comfortable analyzing detailed data relevant to heart rhythm disorders including ECG and clinical data.

The position will be primarily responsible for analyzing clinical text data. The applicant should be comfortable with data management, cleaning, and statistical analyses. The role requires working independently with guidance from senior members of the research team, and communicating results in code, orally, and in writing to internal and external researchers and stakeholders. The position involves curating new datasets and implementing data management procedures. The successful applicant will train and update other researchers and staff on these procedures. The position requires project management skills for collaborators and assisting in the design and management of new projects.
Duties Include
Prioritize and extract data from a variety of sources such as notes, survey results, medical reports, and laboratory data, and maintain its accuracy and completeness.
Determine additional data collection and reporting requirements.
Design and customize reports based upon data in the database. Oversee and monitor regulatory compliance for utilization of the data.
Use system reports and analyses to identify potentially problematic data, make corrections, and eliminate root cause for data problems or justify solutions to be implemented by others.
Create complex charts and databases, perform statistical analyses, and develop graphs and tables for publication and presentation.
Serve as a resource for non-routine inquiries such as requests for statistics or surveys.
Test prototype software and participate in approval and release process for new software.
Provide documentation based on audit and reporting criteria to investigators and research staff.

The job duties listed are typical examples of work performed by positions in this job classification and are not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, tasks, and responsibilities. Specific duties and responsibilities may vary depending on department or program needs without changing the general nature and scope of the job or level of responsibility. Employees may also perform other duties as assigned.
Desired Qualifications
Experience in data science, machine learning, coding and natural language processing would be an advantage.
Prior research experience in medical technology or a clinical research laboratory would be an advantage.
Prior experience of presenting research, and of writing manuscripts will be an advantage.
Education & Experience (required)

Bachelor's degree and three years of relevant experience or combination of education and relevant experience. Experience in a quantitative discipline such as economics, finance, statistics or engineering.
Knowledge, Skills And Abilities (required)
Substantial experience with MS Office and analytical programs.
Excellent writing and analytical skills.
Ability to prioritize workload.
Physical Requirements
Sitting in place at computer for long periods of time with extensive keyboarding/dexterity.
Occasionally use a telephone.
Rarely writing by hand.

This role is based in Montreal, Quebec. We are only considering local applicants at this time.
Company Description

Cubeler Inc. is the creator of the Cubeler™ Business Hub, a gated ecosystem for small and medium-sized businesses that offers SMEs no-cost access to leading, AI-powered SME insights, analytics, marketing, networking, and financing solutions. The Cubeler™ Business Hub is a first-of-its-kind ecosystem dedicated exclusively to SME entrepreneurs, which provides its members with free access to these benefits:
Loans and credit offers
The ability to advertise their products and services to a targeted audience
Local, national and international networking opportunities
A broad spectrum of market intelligence reports
Research-rich, industry-specific content written by industry experts
All Business Hub services are available FREE of charge to members.

Cubeler, whose head office is in Montreal, is a pioneer in AI-powered business insights and analytics. It offers a dynamic work environment and is a part of an international conglomerate with offices in nine cities in China and Canada.
Job Description

The goal of the Business Hub™ is to provide small and medium sized business entrepreneurs with the resources, services and information they need to help their businesses thrive. As our Data Analyst you will be responsible for the descriptive statistical analysis and presentation of our data. This includes the preparation of reporting, dashboards, KPIs, business performance metrics, as well as encompassing anything referred to as ""Business Intelligence."" This role will require interaction with (or querying of) databases, both relational and non-relational, as well as with other data frameworks.

You will be expected to use your expertise by providing recommendations about the methods and ways in which our company obtains data to improve their quality and consistency. You will develop best practices regarding data analysis, data presentation and data visualization.
Responsibilities
Export and manipulate data as needed from different sources, help identify trends or anomalies, and assist with summarizing findings.
Assist with all aspects of delivering reports on a regular basis (refresh reports, conduct QA, summarize findings and key insights).
Revise PowerBI/Tableau/SAS Visual Analytics dashboard content as required to meet changing business needs (create new measures, develop new visualizations, and add new data sources).
Identify opportunities to improve Data Quality and reporting processes for greater efficiency.
Provide experience with Data Quality, IT and Data Governance.
Document and update reports and analysis.
Provide support in answering business questions.
Must Have Qualifications
University degree in Business, Computer Science, Computer Engineering or equivalent degree.
2+ years of experience in a Data Analyst related role.

High proficiency with Power BI (or Tableau or SAS Visual Analytics) (including connecting to data sources, creating new measures and visualizations, and building dashboards that tell a compelling story).
High proficiency in SQL.
Experience coding on Python, Lua, R or SAS.
Knowledge of the Fintech industry.
Advanced English level.
Experience with Google Analytics and Google Cloud Services. (it would be an asset).
Advanced Excel, PowerPoint, Word skills.
Must Have Qualifications
Strong documentation and organizational skills.
Team player. Ability to learn quickly.
Strong analytical and problem solving skills.
Demonstrates sound judgment and initiative.
Attention to detail and ability to work effectively under time constraints.
Ability to handle setbacks.
Good communication skills (written and verbal) and ability to interact comfortably with others at all levels.
Nice to have
You enjoy turning data into actionable insights to help improve the business performance, and sharing those insights through compelling storytelling.
Learning – you are curious by nature with a fiery desire to continuously learn and improve.
The details! – you catch discrepancies from a mile away and can troubleshoot, manage and prioritize multiple tasks efficiently.
Problem Solving - you view challenges as opportunities and enjoy solving problems and removing obstacles.
We offer
Competitive compensation, including stock options
Health benefits
Group RRSP
Paid time off such as sick days and vacation days
Open workspace
Gym membership (Montreal)

column1: 2023-07-11,Boston Planning & Development Agency,Research Coordinator/Data Analyst,"Boston, MA","boston planning & development agency
BOSTON RESIDENCY IS A CONDITION OF EMPLOYMENT AND MUST BE MET WITHIN 6 MONTHS OF START DATE *
TITLE: RESEARCH COORDINATOR / DATA ANALYST
GRADE: 3 STATUS: NON-EXEMPT
DEPARTMENT/DIVISION: RESEARCH
Overview

The Boston Planning & Development Agency (BPDA) is the planning and economic development agency for the City of Boston. The BPDA Research department compiles and analyzes current, historical, and comparative data on the city of Boston. The department conducts research on Boston's economy, population, and commercial markets for all departments of the BPDA, the City of Boston, and related organizations. Under the direction of the Director of Research, the Research Coordinator / Data Analyst will provide data analysis and quantitative and qualitative economic and demographic research. The candidate will support day-to-day division operations, providing administrative assistance for records management, scheduling, procurement, and design.
General Duties And Responsibilities
Research / Data Analysis
Help prepare briefings for BPDA and City staff regarding the economic impact of the COVID-19 pandemic on Boston and the city’s ongoing recovery
Conduct research on Boston’s economy and population using the U.S. Census Bureau, Bureau of Labor Statistics, and other databases
Perform economic and statistical analysis using a variety of specialized software such as STATA and R
Analyze data using GIS software including ArcMap and create maps using a variety of data sources

Create and maintain databases using data from a variety of municipal, governmental, public, and private sources. Assess the shortcomings and integrity of data and explore new data sources and analytic tools
Manage, organize, and interpret data for a non-technical audience
Create presentations, reports, and data visualizations to communicate research findings and information
Work collaboratively on projects and provide technical assistance to Research staff
Research Operations / Project Management
Work with the Deputy Director of Research to support day-to-day division operations
Provide general administrative and project management support for the division
Manage Division’s invoices and contracts, coordinating between vendors, division leadership, and BPDA Finance and Legal departments
Prepare and design division reports and presentations with effective and professional design standards
Manage division website pages
Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in economics, statistics, sociology, related field, or equivalent.

Must have excellent analytical skills with proficiency in Microsoft Office, Google Collaborative Suites, and Adobe Acrobat with advanced Excel skills are a must. Experience in Stata or R and ArcGIS are preferred.
Graphic design / data visualization experience with knowledge of Adobe InDesign are preferred
S uperior project management skills
Capacity to work independently and within a team on specific projects
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Work Environment
Normal office environment
Physical Requirements
Little or no exertion
SCOPE
N/A

The mission of the Health Federation of Philadelphia is to promote health equity for marginalized communities by advancing access to high-quality, integrated, and comprehensive health and human services. Health equity is at the heart of all our work. We believe in and are firmly committed to equal employment opportunity for employees and applicants. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national or ethnic origin, ancestry, age, religion, disability, sex or gender, gender identity and/or expression, sexual orientation, military or veteran status. This commitment applies to all aspects of the Health Federation of Philadelphia’s employment practices, including recruiting, hiring, training, and promotion.
Job Summary

The Electronic Health Records (EHR) Data Analyst will utilize a systematic approach and advanced tools to design, develop and support data management services for the Philadelphia Department of Public Health, Ambulatory Health Services (AHS), a large community health organization. The EHR Data Analyst will be responsible for data request intake, requirements definition, approvals, analytic methods, implementation, delivery and monitoring to deliver advanced data analysis, performance measurement and custom reports to support internal and external requests for clinical, operational and policy insights. The position requires skills and knowledge to manage, analyze, report, distribute and protect EHR related data. This position works directly with AHS Leadership, EHR Program Management Office (EHR PMO) Program staff, and respective partner personnel to support comprehensive planning and tactical delivery of data analytic services in production operations. In addition, responsibilities include Tier 2 and Tier 3 support for EHR production issues and Helpdesk tickets regarding data, visualization, and respective services.
Strategic direction, programmatic and operational prioritization will be specified through the authority of AHS Leadership. Accountability is managed through the EHR PMO with AHS oversight.
JOB SPECIFICATIONS
Responsibilities/Duties

Support the design, development, deployment, and ongoing management of AHS data requests and related work. Work with EHR PMO to integrate data management strategies for projects, programs, and initiatives.

Participate in the design, development, deployment, and support of relational and non-relational database designs in a team-oriented environment using various data visualization tools in accordance with City OIT standards.
Serve as the analytic intermediary between staff, departments and vendors for various database solutions and datasets within on-premises and cloud hosted systems.
Participate in the design and implementation of integration points for automated retrieval, sharing and delivery of incoming and outgoing data.
Assist with data conversion, migration, and validation of data to ensure quality and accuracy.
Develop Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) for EHR data management and related system administration to establish and maintain standards and procedures to support consistent practices.
Abide by the EHR PMO change control policies and procedures while ensuring change control methods are congruent with overall Health IT and OIT procedures
column2: Submit and present various changes related to AHS data management.

Monitor performance of database related systems to ensure system and data integrity
Perform root cause analyses and troubleshoot internal and external data-related problems.
Aid in the support/writing/configuration of data transformation services (DTS) and extract, transform, load (ETL) packages, Web Services, and SQL database objects.
Assist AHS in developing and conducting presentations related to data management.
Maintain working relationships with AHS, EHR, HIT, City OIT, and Partner staff including regular status communications using EHR and AHS methods of communication.
Provide off-hours support for upgrades, problem resolution, outages, or disaster recovery events as needed.
Stay current with data management tools as departmental infrastructure evolves.
Assist AHS leadership & staff as needed to define opportunities for enhanced analytics and data visualization.

Position Location: Toronto HQ
Requisition ID: 23845

We know the importance that food plays in people's lives – the power it has to bring people, families and communities together. Our purpose is to bring enjoyment to people’s lives through great tasting food, in a way which reflects our values.
Overview

McCain is embarking on a digital transformation. As part of this transformation, we are making significant investments into our data structures and policies to increase the quality of our data, the confidence of our business teams to use this data to make decisions and drive value through the use of data.

We have a new and ambitious global Data & Analytics group, which serves as a resource to the business teams in our regions and global functions. We are currently recruiting a talented individual to join our team in the role of Global Data Analyst, with a capability focus on the insights that can be pulled from data.
Job Purpose

Reporting to the Director, Global Analytics, the Senior Global Data Analyst is part of a dynamic, multi-disciplinary team that brings together individuals with a wide range of experiences in business and technology. This challenging role requires strong business knowledge and knowledge of what’s possible from data and digital tools. This role focuses on a general set of analytics capabilities, including the discovery of capabilities that McCain will look to in the future. The role is expected to operate as a leader within McCain’s analytics community, helping set the future-looking analytics agenda and building capabilities across the organization.

Requirement Gathering: Conduct requirements analysis with business stakeholders, and communicate technical requirements to the development team
Understand requirements and propose further technical solutions beyond what the business owner may initially conceptualize
Lead data discovery to ensure project viability

Develop analytics directly, with independence

Resolve any roadblocks and issues that could impact timelines
Ensure quality assurance through user testing and feedback iteration
Systems Design: Work directly with the Global Data Platforms team to support architecture design that effectively interfaces with BI systems and applications
Future Analytics Capability Discovery: Lead our efforts to identify and gain adoption of new analytics capabilities that can drive value across McCain regions and functions
Learning and Development: Remain current with the latest analytics tools systems that can further McCain’s analytical agenda

2 - 6 years of experience working in data-driven environments

Digital Skills

Understanding of SQL or any other programming languages such as Python, R, or SAS
Data Literacy and Communication
Understanding of how data systems are designed and ability to work with data engineers
Ability to connect data to business insights for non-technical audiences
Ability to translate non-technical business requirements into technical solutions

Comfortable working with business stakeholders across a range of experience with data and analytics
Able to establish a case for change and “sell” an idea
Able to explain data concepts in a way that is approachable and compelling
Project Management: defining and shaping your own agenda
Experience with managing and influencing executive-level audiences, including meeting facilitation, hypothesis generation and delivering conclusions
A documented history of successfully driving projects to completion

column1: 2023-07-26,Get It Recruit - Finance,Sr. Data Analyst (Finance) - Remote | WFH,"Seattle, WA","We are currently seeking an experienced Senior Data Analyst to join our dynamic team and be a key player in shaping our analytics initiatives. Data quality and integrity: Ensure data accuracy, consistency, and integrity by implementing data cleansing and validation techniques.

Collaborate with cross-functional teams: Work closely with marketing teams, sales teams, and other stakeholders to align marketing analytics initiatives with business objectives and support data-driven decision-making processes.
Stay up to date with industry trends: Keep abreast of industry trends, emerging technologies, and best practices in marketing analytics to enhance the effectiveness of marketing strategies.
Required Skills & Experience:
5+ years of experience in B2B marketing, preferably marketing analytics
Relevant experience and/or certifications in Marketo, Tableau, advanced Excel, SFDC (Salesforce), SalesLoft or Outreach
Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret complex data sets and generate actionable insights
Experience working with CRM systems (preferably Salesforce) and marketing automation platforms

2023-07-17,Elliot Hospital,SR DATA ANALYST - HYBRID 5K sign on bonus!,"Manchester, NH","POSITION SUMMARY

Solid problem solving, trouble shooting, root cause analysis skills, strong analytic skills and experience with analysis of data for improvement, population health and/or research required.

column2: experience analyzing large data sets and creating dashboards.

column1: Excellent oral and written communication skills including ability to present complex information effectively with a wide range audience.

column2: work independently as well as in a team environment
column3: and deal effectively with complex assignments and projects essential.

column1: Strong leadership skills including the ability to learn, lead, coach, teach, and inspire required.

Education: Bachelor s degree in analytics, computer science, engineering, public health, or related field required. Master s Degree in Public Health, Healthcare Administration or other healthcare related field preferred.

Job Profile
Position Overview

At PNC, our people are our greatest differentiator and competitive advantage in the markets we serve. We are all united in delivering the best experience for our customers. We work together each day to foster an inclusive workplace culture where all of our employees feel respected, valued and have an opportunity to contribute to the company’s success. As a Data Analytics Development Program Analyst/Associate within PNC's Corporate & Institutional Banking (C&IB) and Asset Management Group (AMG) organization, you will be based in Pittsburgh, PA.
Job Description
Data Analytics Development Program Analyst/Associate

By joining one of PNC’s Development Programs, you can explore your potential through hands-on experience in a professional environment. This is an excellent opportunity to begin exploring your career goals, in addition to growing your skills in key areas. The goal of PNC’s Development Programs is to move analysts and associates from development roles into production roles in one of PNC’s lines of business.

The Corporate & Institutional Banking (C&IB) and Asset Management Group (AMG) divisions are high-growth businesses within PNC committed to driving its growth through the use of advanced analytics and data science. The Data Analytics Development Program provides its associates with the opportunity to gain exposure to both divisions. Associates in this program will support these businesses by providing analytical foresight and insight to help make effective business decisions related to client growth, product performance, operations and other business strategies.

Through coursework and projects, associates will gain proficiency in a wide range of advanced analytical techniques to manipulate, analyze, interpret, and visualize various types, structures and volumes of data across C&IB and AMG. Associates will be fully embedded within the lines of businesses during the 18 month program enabling them to gain the necessary business knowledge to develop data products that meet the needs of the organization. Associates will gain exposure to commercial portfolio analytics, data engineering, machine learning and data visualization. It is expected that upon completion of the program, associates will have a strong background in data analysis, computational modeling, programming languages and frameworks (SQL, Python, R, etc.), product development and deployment, exposure to the C&IB and AMG big data ecosystem and the ability to generate data-driven insights for the organization.

Based on business need and upon successful completion of the Data Analytics Development Program, associates could be placed in a role that provides the opportunity to work in a number of analytics disciplines including Data Science, Business Analytics and Visualization.
Opportunities in the Data Analytics Development Program are primarily located in Pittsburgh.

2023-07-25,Hakkoda,Data Governance Analyst,United States,"About Hakkoda

Hakkoda is a modern data consultancy that empowers data driven organizations to realize the full value of the Snowflake Data Cloud. We provide consulting and managed services in data architecture, data engineering, analytics and data science. We are renowned for bringing our clients deep expertise, being easy to work with, and being an amazing place to work! We are looking for curious and creative individuals who want to be part of a fast-paced, dynamic environment, where everyone’s input and efforts are valued. We hire outstanding individuals and give them the opportunity to thrive in a collaborative atmosphere that values learning, growth, and hard work. Our team is distributed across North America, Latin America, and Europe. If you have the desire to be a part of an exciting, challenging, and rapidly-growing Snowflake consulting services company, and if you are passionate about making a difference in this world, we would love to talk to you!.
Role Description:

A Hakkoda Data Governance Analyst will work with data teams in the formation and execution of data governance framework, policy, and standards. This role will help develop and implement data governance principles within various business areas of our client organizations in order to establish a unified, holistic approach to data governance and, ultimately, drive a high level of data quality throughout the organization. Keys to success in this role are the ability to build strong partnerships with business and IT stakeholders. The ideal candidate will have professional data governance experience, strong business acumen, and will be able to leverage these competencies to provide stewardship and oversight of critical data assets.
What we are looking for:

We are looking for people with experience designing and building enterprise data strategies for implementation, integration and usage of data. The successful candidate will have experience interacting with business and IT stakeholders to advance an organization's thinking of data governance concepts, ability to explain the benefits of data governance policies and procedures within the context of the business needs.
Qualifications, Skills And Experience
6+ years of relevant data management consulting or industry experience (master data, metadata, data architecture, data governance, data quality, data modeling and data standards)
Data governance execution and/or operationalization experience
Experience in analyzing the status and developing recommendations to improve accountability, quality, and adherence to data policies, standards and quality improvement efforts
Experience in driving solution design and execution of data governance efforts spanning across business lines, technology, and platforms to address enterprise data needs
Experience performing data audits, identify data collection issues, suggest improvements and help implement fixes
Ability to define data security standards
Experience defining standard frameworks that align with overall business and technology strategies
Bachelor's degree or equivalent work experience
Experience with data governance and data quality tools such as Alation, Atlan, Collibra, Great Expectations, etc
Strong oral and written communication skills, including presentation skills
Ability to create critical collaterals for client workshops and customer interactive sessions
Strong problem solving and troubleshooting skills with the ability to exercise mature judgment
Data Governance certification/s (i.e.: DAMA, Certified Data Management Professional (CDMP) or Data Governance and Stewardship Professional (DGSP) are a plus

2023-07-28,PNC,Data Analytics Undergraduate Intern,"Pittsburgh, PA","R142166
Job Profile
Position Overview

At PNC, our people are our greatest differentiator and competitive advantage in the markets we serve. We are all united in delivering the best experience for our customers. We work together each day to foster an inclusive workplace culture where all of our employees feel respected, valued and have an opportunity to contribute to the company’s success. As a Data Analytics Undergraduate Intern within PNC's Corporate & Institutional Banking (C&IB) and Asset Management Group (AMG) organizations, you will be based in Pittsburgh, PA
Job Description
Data Analytics Undergraduate Intern

As a PNC Intern, you will participate in a “best-in-class” internship program. During this 10-week program, you will have the opportunity to gain exposure to a specific line of business, expand the tools you need to launch your career and complement your education with real-world experience.

The Corporate & Institutional Banking (C&IB) and Asset Management Group (AMG) divisions are high-growth businesses within PNC committed to driving its growth through the use of advanced analytics and data science. The Data Analytics Internship Program provides interns with the opportunity to gain exposure to both divisions. Interns will support these businesses by providing analytical foresight and insight to help make effective business decisions related to client growth, product performance, operations and other business strategies.

Interns will gain exposure to a wide range of advanced analytical techniques to manipulate, analyze, interpret, and visualize various types, structures and volumes of data across C&IB and AMG. Interns will gain exposure to commercial portfolio analytics, data engineering, machine learning, and data visualization. It is expected that upon completion of the program, interns will have a stronger background in data analysis, computational modeling, programming languages and frameworks (SQL, Python, R, etc.), product development and deployment, exposure to the C&IB and AMG big data ecosystem and the ability to generate data-driven insights for the organization.

The Summer Internship Program is a direct pipeline for talent to the C&IB and AMG divisions, providing interns with an unparalleled opportunity to learn the business while gaining visibility among the firm’s senior leadership.
Opportunities in the Data Analytics Internship Program are primarily located in Pittsburgh.

This position is primarily based in a PNC location. Responsibilities require time in the office or in the field on a regular basis. Some responsibilities may be performed remotely, at manager’s discretion.
Learn more about PNC’s Summer Internship by visiting www.pnc.jobs/students.
Job Profile
Participates as an intern in the PNC summer internship program.

Performs or assist the core activities of the group by applying knowledge learned to drive business results (e.g., deal, sales, process support, internal or external customer interaction, or supporting internal projects). Works under supervision and may have limited approval and/or exception authority.

Participates in social learning within the organization (e.g., identifies and networks with business representatives and peers, participates in mentoring, job shadowing and community outreach projects).
Required Education And Experience

Working toward a Bachelor's Degree, preferably STEM or business majors (e.g. Analytics, Data Science, Math, Statistics, Physics, Computer Science, Finance, Economics, Business). Other majors can be considered if there is a strong proven interest in data analytics.
Minimum GPA 3.2.

2023-07-31,"Dignari, LLC",Data Analyst | HYBRID,"Springfield, VA","Dignari is a forward-thinking, human-centered, emerging technology and analytics company that builds solutions to transform business. We're a woman owned company where diversity is applauded and success is celebrated.
We are seeking a Data Analyst to join our expanding business. This position is located with our client in the Washington, D.C. Metro Area but is currently on a hybrid contract.
The Data Analyst will report to Dignari program leadership and to the federal client supporting the Transportation Security Administration (TSA) within the U.S. Department of Homeland Security (DHS).
POSITION RESPONSIBILITIES:
Translates data into business insights, essentially converting numbers into stories that can guide business decisions.
Demonstrates a passion for understanding the ""what and whys"" of data.
Works in a collaborative environment with various project teams to support DHS - TSA analytics and data visualizations.
Provides various areas of data governance and data hygiene to ensure data accuracy.
Provides advice, assistance and written recommendations based on data analysis and results to inform client decisions.
Communicates with the PowerBI and data team members to provide accurate analytics and reports for clients.
Responsible for the accurate and timely delivery of reports and data requests. Required to develop a broad understanding of data sets available.
Assists with the development implementation, and maintenance of good and accurate data flowing from User inputs to reporting outputs.
Develops and maintains quality control standard and data reconciliation techniques for internal and external reporting.
Conducts quality control and auditing of databases in a client/server environment to ensure accurate and appropriate use of data.
Understands current state processes and recommends improvements to make programs and processes more efficient and effective.
Understands client needs and pain points to recommend requirements in DHS data systems.
Promotes compliance with agreed data governance principles, and where necessary, takes action to respond to improper activities in relation to secondary use of data.
Analizes data from relational databases and understand data structures.
Explains and documents complex methodologies in plain language.
Liaisons with the technical development team by articulating operational and mission needs.
POSITION REQUIREMENTS:
Bachelor’s degree
5+ years of experience
Skillset: SQL, PowerBI, R, descriptive statistics, data visualization, problem-solving, product intuition, stakeholder management.
Excellent analytical and presentation skills
Must have received or be willing to receive the COVID-19 Vaccination or have accommodation documents completed by the date of hire to be considered. Proof of vaccination is required.
PROFESSIONAL EXPECTATIONS:

Passionate about data analytics with a willingness to dig deep in to the data to scrutinize and validate results, and then take a step back to present the data in customer friendly terms to help clients make decisions.

Eager to work closely with clients to assess best data sources while also having the patience and poise to work through government hurdles to aggregate data from disparate systems in to a single source.
Aptitude and willingness to work to become a trusted advisor to clients who share in your passion for all things data.

2023-07-20,Stanford University School of Medicine,Research Data Analyst 2,"Stanford, CA","The Division of Cardiovascular Medicine is a dynamic and innovative center dedicated to excellence in research, medical education, and clinical care. Our division is driven by over 80 faculty, clinician educators and instructors who are the pillar of strength in the Division's ongoing efforts into the prevention and treatment of cardiovascular disease.

The Computational Arrhythmia Research laboratory works at the intersection of bioengineering, data science and cardiac electrophysiology (heart rhythm disorders). Our goal is to use detailed data from patients to better understand disease mechanisms, particularly for atrial fibrillation and ventricular tachycardia, and use computational models, machine learning and other tools to develop improved diagnostic and treatment tools.

We are currently seeking a highly skilled and motivated Research Data Analyst 2 to join our team. The ideal applicant will have experience in coding in python and other languages in the fields of artificial intelligence (AI), machine learning (ML) and natural language processing (NLP) of electronic health records (EHR) data. The Research Data Analyst will use NLP to process and analyze diverse data sources, including de-identified clinical records, for clinically relevant medical issues in patients with heart rhythm disorders. The applicant should be comfortable analyzing detailed data relevant to heart rhythm disorders including ECG and clinical data.

The position will be primarily responsible for analyzing clinical text data. The applicant should be comfortable with data management, cleaning, and statistical analyses. The role requires working independently with guidance from senior members of the research team, and communicating results in code, orally, and in writing to internal and external researchers and stakeholders. The position involves curating new datasets and implementing data management procedures. The successful applicant will train and update other researchers and staff on these procedures. The position requires project management skills for collaborators and assisting in the design and management of new projects.
Duties Include
Prioritize and extract data from a variety of sources such as notes, survey results, medical reports, and laboratory data, and maintain its accuracy and completeness.
Determine additional data collection and reporting requirements.
Design and customize reports based upon data in the database. Oversee and monitor regulatory compliance for utilization of the data.
Use system reports and analyses to identify potentially problematic data, make corrections, and eliminate root cause for data problems or justify solutions to be implemented by others.
Create complex charts and databases, perform statistical analyses, and develop graphs and tables for publication and presentation.
Serve as a resource for non-routine inquiries such as requests for statistics or surveys.
Test prototype software and participate in approval and release process for new software.
Provide documentation based on audit and reporting criteria to investigators and research staff.

The job duties listed are typical examples of work performed by positions in this job classification and are not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, tasks, and responsibilities. Specific duties and responsibilities may vary depending on department or program needs without changing the general nature and scope of the job or level of responsibility. Employees may also perform other duties as assigned.
Desired Qualifications
Experience in data science, machine learning, coding and natural language processing would be an advantage.
Prior research experience in medical technology or a clinical research laboratory would be an advantage.
Prior experience of presenting research, and of writing manuscripts will be an advantage.
Education & Experience (required)

Bachelor's degree and three years of relevant experience or combination of education and relevant experience. Experience in a quantitative discipline such as economics, finance, statistics or engineering.
Knowledge, Skills And Abilities (required)
Substantial experience with MS Office and analytical programs.
Excellent writing and analytical skills.
Ability to prioritize workload.
Physical Requirements
Sitting in place at computer for long periods of time with extensive keyboarding/dexterity.
Occasionally use a telephone.
Rarely writing by hand.

Consistent with its obligations under the law, the University will provide reasonable accommodation to any employee with a disability who requires accommodation to perform the essential functions of his or her job.
Working Conditions
Some work may be performed in a laboratory or field setting.
