2023-07-12,"Cydecor, Inc.",Business Data Analyst,"Norfolk, VA","At InnovaSystems, extraordinary solutions are born through innovative software.

A wholly owned subsidiary of Cydecor, InnovaSystems is a leading provider of information technology and enterprise-level solutions to the Department of Defense, federal, state, and local government agencies, delivering a vital service to support our nation’s National Security Strategy. We engage organizational effectiveness and readiness resulting in reduced costs, increased effectiveness, and accessibility.
As a member of the InnovaSystems team, you will be empowered to do the best work of your career with challenging assignments and collaborative teams that solve real-world problems.
Some of our perks & benefits include:

Flexible schedule & telecommute options, continuous learning opportunities including technical training and Leadership development programs, comprehensive benefits package, onsite gym/workout facilities, 401k plan w/ company match, competitive salary and a fantastic culture of collaboration.
Successful applicants will be asked to show proof of their U.S. Citizenship.
Job Role:

InnovaSystems has a need for a Data Analyst for its Navy Readiness Reporting Enterprise - Business Intelligence (NRRE-BI) project team. Using modern program languages and data analysis toolkits such as Python, R, and Databricks, the successful candidate will work with the Product Owner, data analysts, and data engineers to provide analysis and data-driven decision support products to the government customer. This work requires someone who can communicate and coordinate with stakeholders, subject matter experts, user experience architects, and the product owner to determine and execute prioritized tasks aligned with customer requirements. The candidate must possess a strong ability to clearly communicate complex analysis and related data requirements orally and in writing while closely adhering to required formats. Will assist in the development and management of requirements during brainstorming, refining and planning activities. Requires a strong commitment to learning requirements development best practices associated with agile development methodologies. Also requires a strong commitment to learn the Navy's business domain. The work will be conducted in person on classified systems with infrequent opportunity for remote work.
Due to the nature of our business, the candidate must hold an Active DoD issued Secret Security Clearance upon hire.
Skills Required:
Effective written and oral communication skills a must
Ability to communicate with customers, stakeholders, and an agile software development team
Experience researching customer concepts, capturing requirements, and analyzing information is a must
Must be comfortable with iterative development and expeditious testing of multiple hypothesis
Capable/experienced in collecting/manipulating data and building predictive models
Must have a working knowledge of Python, R, SQL and Databricks
Proficiency in MS Office Suite a must, including Excel
Experience with report / dashboard features of Qlik, Microsoft Power BI, IBM Cognos and/or Tableau highly desired
Strong commitment to learn the Navy readiness production business domain is a must
Able to work on site in SIPR a must
Knowledge of Navy Readiness a must
Skills Desired:
Familiarity with SQL queries is a plus
Experience with Scrum or other Agile methods
Education:

BS in CS or in related discipline, and 4-6 years experience as a data analyst or similar analysis discipline that required research, analysis, and critical thinking for developing software requirements or technical documentation.
Our comprehensive employee benefits offerings include:
Flexible schedule
Company-paid employee development learning and licenses

2023-07-20,Knowesis Inc.,Clinical Data Analyst,"Baltimore, MD","Position: Clinical Data Analyst
Location: A hybrid position in Baltimore, MD
Clearance Required: Public Trust
Status: Contingent upon contract award

Knowesis is currently seeking an experienced Clinical Data Analyst to provide clinical data analyst support services for the 711 Human Performance Wing (711 HPW), Airman Systems Directorate, Warfighter Medical Optimization Division, Product Development Branch, Enroute Care (RHBAM). As a Clinical Data Analyst, you will play a vital role in supporting the analysis and interpretation of clinical data to drive evidence-based decision-making and improve USAF processes and outcomes. You will be responsible for organizing and analyzing large volumes of healthcare data from diverse sources such as electronic health records (EHRs), vital sign databases, clinical trials, and other health information systems.
This position requires a Public Trust clearance and requires U.S. Citizenship (applicants without proof of US citizenship will not be considered due to the position’s security clearance requirement).
The Job Duties and Responsibilities include but are not limited to the following:
Data Collection and Cleaning: Gather and extract clinical data from various sources, ensuring data accuracy and integrity. Clean, transform, and normalize data for analysis purposes.
Data Analysis and Interpretation:

Utilize statistical techniques and data mining methodologies to analyze complex clinical datasets. Identify trends, patterns, and correlations within the data to derive meaningful insights and actionable recommendations.

Write scripts to integrate data, conduct exploratory data analysis to discover hidden trends, apply machine learning to train predictive models, and use the right combination of tools and frameworks to turn complex sets of disparate data points into objective answers that inform decisions.
Utilize statistical analysis, unsupervised machine learning, supervised machine learning, and deep learning as needed.

Biostatistical Research Support: Collaborate with researchers and clinicians to provide analytical support for clinical studies and research projects. Assist in study design, sample size estimation, data collection methods, and statistical analysis plans.
Data Visualization and Reporting:
Create clear and concise visualizations, reports, and dashboards to communicate data-driven insights to investigators.

Present findings in a compelling manner, tailored to the target audience. Generate publication quality graphs and write associated manuscript sections to describe methodology and results in detail for inclusion in scientific publications.
Clearly and effectively communicate results in writing and in oral presentations.

Quality Assurance: Ensure the accuracy and reliability of clinical data by conducting quality assurance checks and implementing data validation procedures. Identify and resolve data discrepancies or anomalies.

Compliance and Data Privacy: Adhere to regulatory requirements and maintain strict confidentiality of patient health information (PHI) in accordance with privacy laws and ethical guidelines such as HIPAA.

Continuous Improvement: Stay abreast of industry trends, advancements in data analytics methodologies, and emerging technologies. Explore opportunities to enhance data collection, analysis, and reporting processes. Review scientific publications and literature to validate theories and models.

Teamwork: Collaborate with multi-disciplinary teams (including university and USAF personnel) to design and execute technical studies across a variety of domains. Work independently and collaboratively in a team environment.
Required Qualifications:
A minimum of three years of experience.
Must have an extensive background in biological data analysis, with a specific focus in clinical datasets.
MUST HAVE EXPERIENCE WITH CLINICAL DATA SETS TO BE CONSIDERED.
Must have experience with data visualization tools (i.e. Tableau) and techniques to develop and deliver impactful data models and data visualizations.

Must have experience with querying or analyzing data to answer questions and solve problems and familiarity with different databases, with required experience in REDCap (Research Electronic Data Capture).
Must exhibit proficiency in data analysis and statistical software including SigmaPlot (Systat), R, Python, SAS, Matlab, SQL, and other relevant programming environments.
Must have experience with statistics and statistical analysis of data, machine learning algorithms, and general algorithm development.
Must have strong analytical skills with the ability to work with a variety of large and complex datasets including (but not limited to) basic research datasets and clinical data.
Must have experience with electronic medical records.
Must have one first author manuscript in a peer-reviewed journal on a study directly analyzing statistical differences in clinical variables.
Must possess excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, to effectively convey complex findings to non-technical stakeholders.
Must possess strong attention to detail, problem-solving abilities, and the capacity to work independently and collaboratively in a team environment.
Must be willing to travel up to 10%.
Required Education:
Master’s degree in data science, Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Data Analytics, or another related technical discipline

2023-07-28,Grant Street Group,Data Conversion Analyst (Remote),"Pittsburgh, PA","The first 90% of a data conversion is simple, but the remaining 10% is where the fun starts. That’s where you get to exercise your problem-solving skills. If the following describes you, you’re a perfect fit for the data conversion analyst role at Grant Street Group.

You want to work with a team of awesome project managers, business analysts, developers, and data analysts to migrate clients to our TaxSys software. At Grant Street, you will have the opportunity to be part of a project team of 2-3 developers and 2-3 data analysts (including yourself). You will prepare data for customer training, verification by customer subject matter experts, and of course TaxSys go-live.

You love analyzing data and solving puzzles. In this position, you will help reverse-engineer legacy tax data and write specs for conversion into TaxSys. Developers will implement them, and you’ll QA the results and refine the specs. You’ll track down bad customer data and figure out how it got that way.

You’re an excellent communicator. Communication, both written and verbal, is what you do. You’ll work on specs for developers, documentation status updates for management, and customer communications. You know your audience, and you adapt to their needs and technical level. You keep it brief and to the point.

You love working with people. As a data conversion analyst, you’ll be the face of Grant Street Group. You’ll guide clients as they verify their data in TaxSys. You’ll help them understand tradeoffs and make decisions – for example, between “more” and “cleaner” data. Description

﻿﻿We're SmartThings, one of the leading IoT ecosystems in the world, creating the most effortless way for anyone to create a smart home. As an independent subsidiary of Samsung, our corporate offices are based in Minneapolis, the Bay Area, and remote home offices throughout the US.

More than 270 million people worldwide use SmartThings to control and manage their connected life. SmartThings delivers simple, powerful experiences across Samsung's leading portfolio of phones, TVs, and appliances. We offer the most versatile smart home experience as an open platform with a rich partner ecosystem. As a founding member of Matter, we are a leader in the industry to help make smart homes more secure, reliable and seamless to use.

SmartThings' culture is built around our core values, offering singular opportunities to make a real, immediate impact in every role. With our focus on trusted ownership, connected leadership, and radical empathy, we embrace inclusive practices and celebrate everyone's uniqueness on our team.

Like the smartphone revolution, smart home technology is transforming the way we interact with the world around us. With SmartThings products, we're reducing global emissions, improving service industries, and creating a safer, smarter planet. Come be a part of the transformation with us! Do the SmartThings!
About The Team

SmartThings is seeking a Senior Data Analyst to join our Product Operations team. Collaborating closely with leaders across the organization, you will play a pivotal role in establishing and leading new data analytics initiatives at SmartThings. You will be responsible for leveraging data to gain valuable insights, power data-driven decision-making, and enhance the overall performance and user experience of our smart home solutions. This is a unique opportunity to shape the future of SmartThings through analytics and drive innovation in the IoT domain.
Key Responsibilities
Collaborate with Samsung's Big Data Center and other global data teams to power our product decisions by enhancing existing datasets, reporting, and dashboards.

Act as a data-driven thought partner to our Product Managers and Product leadership team. Educate our teams to help us ask better questions, interpret findings more effectively, and drive informed decision making.
Develop or enhance self-service data tools to power insight, discovery, and communication. Conduct individual analyses when needed to drive business objectives, and facilitate training.

Build and execute on a roadmap for data enhancements to align with SmartThings' product vision and business objectives. Understand and communicate the building blocks needed, identify any gaps, and drive progress toward best-in-class practices.

Support data collection, governance, and compliance initiatives in partnership with teams across SmartThings globally. Identify and collect relevant data from different sources, ensuring data accuracy and completeness. Partner with global security teams to ensure compliance with data privacy regulations and data governance policies while handling sensitive information and conducting analyses.
Provide technical leadership by staying up-to-date with industry best practices, trends, and emerging technologies to continuously improve our approach.
Skills Knowledge And Expertise
Inclusive Hiring Practices

Our hiring team is passionate about diversity, equity and inclusion, and the data shows that candidates from underrepresented groups are less likely than others to apply for a career opportunity if their qualifications and experience don't appear to be an identical match. We welcome candidates from every professional background, so even if you aren't certain you meet every requirement, we encourage you to apply!

Proficiency in data analysis tools/programming languages such as Python, R, SQL, or similar, and experience with data visualization
Strong analytical mindset, customer orientation, and curiosity
Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively with diverse teams and stakeholders around the globe
Ability to shift effectively between detail-oriented work and big-picture thinking
5+ years of experience in data analytics, or similar role
Bachelor's or Master's degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, or a related field, or equivalent experience.
Desired Skills
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Superset, Power BI, Tableau)
Passion for IoT and smart home technologies, with a desire to contribute to an industry-leading company.
Knowledge of Korean language
International business and organizational experience
SmartThings Benefits
Why You'll Love Working at SmartThings

You'll receive a competitive compensation package and comprehensive health benefits (medical, dental, vision, HSA with employer contribution, life & disability insurance, a competitive 401(k) with a 5% employer match, and more)
You'll have access to generous paid leave for parents, including 8 weeks Parental Leave and 8 more weeks for Childbirth Recovery Leave paid at 100%
You'll enjoy work/life flexibility through our unlimited PTO plan, Summer Fridays, 12 paid holidays each year, and an emphasis on work/life balance.

Our commitment to diversity, equity, inclusion and belonging is embedded into our culture and our work, and you'll have opportunities to join forums and groups and participate in our ongoing projects.
We are a group of bright, kind, and goal-oriented people. You can be your authentic self here, and are empowered to encourage others to do the same!

We are a technologically and data-driven business.
We are committed to our customers and developers.
We love solving problems, thinking creatively, and trying new things.

2023-07-28,Aurora,Data Engine Operations Analyst,"Pittsburgh, PA","Who We Are

Aurora (Nasdaq: AUR) is delivering the benefits of self-driving technology safely, quickly, and broadly to make transportation safer, increasingly accessible, and more reliable and efficient than ever before. The Aurora Driver is a self-driving system designed to operate multiple vehicle types, from freight-hauling semi-trucks to ride-hailing passenger vehicles, and underpins Aurora Horizon and Aurora Connect, its driver-as-a-service products for trucking and ride-hailing. Aurora is working with industry leaders across the transportation ecosystem, including Toyota, FedEx, Volvo Trucks, PACCAR, Uber, Uber Freight, U.S. Xpress, Werner, Covenant, Schneider, and Ryder. For Aurora’s latest news, visit aurora.tech and @aurora_inno on Twitter.

Aurora hires talented people with diverse backgrounds who are ready to help build a transportation ecosystem that will make our roads safer, get crucial goods where they need to go and make mobility more efficient and accessible for all.

On the Data Engine team you will join a world-class group exploring computer vision, machine learning, and state of the art data annotation with human-in-the-loop tooling. In this role, we are looking for an exceptional operations analyst to join our team that thrives on teamwork, getting things done, expert attention to detail, and with an ability to navigate virtual environments that help our team deliver best-in-class training data. If your passions align with working on cross functional teams to deliver the highest quality data and enabling the right workflows or processes to deliver, the Data Engine team could have the perfect opportunity for you.

Variant video-based labeling
Metadata labeling and sub-categorization
Quality assessment and auditing of data annotations
Review and evaluate output generated by model and provide feedback or corrections as necessary
Orchestrate existing workflows and provide feedback on both tooling and process
Ability to respond to changing team priorities and properly allocate time to highest priority tasks
Collaborate on training materials for deployment of tasks at scale
Interact with and Interpret dashboards and reports to track throughput of high priority tasks

2+ years of relevant systems experience (i.e. 3D modeling software, image-based editing software, data entry, and/or proprietary data platforms, self driving operations)
Strong attention to detail
Solid communication and critical thinking skills to convey feedback on complex scenarios
Desirable Qualifications
Former labeling experience regardless of domain
Understanding of machine learning concepts and computer vision
Strong process and metrics focus with a passion for getting things done

The hourly range for this position is $25.25 - $29.00. Aurora’s pay ranges are determined by role, level, and location. Within the range, the successful candidate’s starting base pay will be determined based on factors including job-related skills, experience, qualifications, relevant education or training, and market conditions. These ranges may be modified in the future. The successful candidate will also be eligible for an annual bonus, equity compensation, and benefits.
#Entry-Level
Working at Aurora

At Aurora, we bring together extraordinarily talented and experienced people united by the strength of our values. We operate with integrity, set outrageous goals, and build a culture where we win together — all without any jerks.

We have offices in several locations across the United States, where we encourage team and cross-functional collaboration. Aurora offers competitive medical, dental, and vision benefits, and additional healthcare support including medical transportation reimbursement, fertility, adoption, and surrogacy benefits. We empower our employees and their families with options to further their unique physical, mental, and financial well-being.

Our Learning and Development offerings include Aurora Academy, where our people learn, develop, and practice the essential skills that drive Aurora’s mission, continually up-leveling our team along the way. Our Careers page provides insight into career opportunities at Aurora, and you can find all the latest news on our Blog.

Safety is central to everything we do. Every employee at Aurora has a role in contributing to safety, every step of the way. We seek candidates who take active responsibility, can contribute to building an atmosphere of trust, and invest in the organization's long-term success by working safely — no matter what.

We believe that self-driving technology has broad benefits – including increased access to transportation. To realize those benefits, we need a workforce with diverse experiences, insights, and perspectives — a workforce that reflects the communities our technology will serve.

Aurora is committed to providing access to anyone who seeks information from our website. Aurora considers qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. We are also committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and disabled veterans in our job application procedures. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, you may contact us at careersiteaccommodations@aurora.tech.
For California applicants, information collected and processed as part of your application and any job applications you choose to submit is subject to Aurora’s California Employment Privacy Policy.
Diversity, Equity and Inclusion
At Aurora, every employee is empowered to take an active role in building an inclusive, collaborative, and unified culture that leverages our diverse strengths, perspectives, and backgrounds.

Transforming how the world moves people and goods involves seeking to understand backgrounds, insights, and lived experiences that differ from our own. One way we accomplish that is with our 15 employee-led Aurora Unified Groups, which support diverse voices and drive inclusive collaboration. We believe that teamwork, belonging, and trust motivate and support our employees to do their best work. As our team grows, we strive to attract and retain exceptional talent that adds new perspectives and experiences and continues to drive innovation. Learn more on our Culture Page.

Job Description Summary:

We are seeking a highly motivated team player with strong analytical skills who specializes in creating, driving, and executing projects. As a Compliance Data Analyst and a rule writer, this person will be providing solutions for managing and optimizing the routing processes for GFCCP Workforce Planning and Management program at PayPal. This role will primarily involve in creating the backend routing rules, configuration, reporting, troubleshooting, and data analysis projects for these programs by providing insights to solve complex routing business problems. This person will also be working closely with our technology partners in defining requirements for application enhancements, global operations partners, for identifying and driving sustainable operational improvements, as well as with the Policy teams to ensure proper implementation of controls. If you are a driven, analytical thinker that values collaboration, continuous learning, and problem-solving, we would love to hear from you.
Job Description:
Responsibilities:
Plan, design, develop/implement code/configuration for backend routing and prioritization logic
Troubleshoot all routing and prioritization logic issues, and provide solution by working with our technology and business partners
Perform data analysis to determine and verify business requirements/issues specification, flows, and deliverables for all routing and prioritization projects
Prepare essential documentation to define requirements, test plans, analysis
Create and execute test cases and scripts for testing of changes and rule releases
Create reporting dashboards for proactive monitoring of queue data for any potential routing related issues
Create tailored business rules to identify a spike in volume for backend queues, inform our key stakeholders, and review reduction strategies
Performs data mining to look for commonalities and patterns that exist
Extract and manipulate large datasets using standard tools such as SQL, Excel, SAS, and Python
Share findings by organizing the data results into easy-to-understand frameworks using Tableau or other visualization tools
Qualifications:
Ability to independently manage, organize and prioritize multiple tasks, projects, and responsibilities
Well-developed research and analytical skills with good problem solving and lateral thinking ability
Analysis of existing applications to identify weakness and develop opportunities for improvements
Ability to rapidly learn new concepts (technical, risk, business) a critical success factor in this role
Team-oriented, must be self-motivated, plan and manage time effectively, and be customer-focused
Detailed, thorough, diligent individual with robust data analysis, and time management skills
Proven ability to function well independently as well as in a team
Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to articulate concepts and ideas to diverse audiences
Experience within the financial industry, with payments/ (e-Commerce knowledge preferred)
Experience in UNIX and Windows shell scripting for process automation
Experience in volume routing decision systems such as Genesys (Coding experience)
Experience with SQL scripting (Oracle, MS SQL), Python, and tableau
Experience with system testing of large applications: the creation of test cases, execution of tests, and validation of results
Bachelor's degree in a quantitative field (Engineering, Science, Finance, Statistics, Economics, Math, Business) with 3 years of experience or a Master's degree with 1 year of experience
Preferred Qualifications:
Experience in risk management (AML, Fraud, Brand Risk Management, Due Diligence, Credit, Compliance, Sanctions, CIP/KYC etc.)
Experience in payments industry

2023-07-26,Beacon Health System,Senior Data Analyst,"Granger, IN","Reports to the Manager, Business Intelligence. This may include building statistical models, diagnosing, validating, and improving the performance of these models over time in addition to creating efficient and reusable processes meant for the improvement, manipulation, and analysis of data. Additionally the Sr. Data Analyst leads data projects from requirements gathering to project implementation, identifying and communicating risks and issues along the way to ensure successful project delivery. This analytical role develops KPIs and other reporting mechanisms within Beacon for the purpose of identifying trends and evaluating the success of the Beacon's initiatives.
Supports the development and maintenance of a system-wide data analytics platform and function by:

Develop a deep understanding of data structures and business knowledge to ensure veracity of the data presented in BI platform. Develop, execute, and document best practices associated to extracting data from BI landscape to educate end users.

2023-07-27,Cognitiv,Senior or Lead Data Science Analyst,"Bellevue, WA","Cognitiv leverages deep learning artificial intelligence to build custom algorithms that more accurately and efficiently predict consumer purchase behavior. Each marketer has a unique set of goals, which is why Cognitiv created NeuralMind, a deep learning platform capable of automatically building custom algorithms that simultaneously consider the user, the context, the message, and the campaign objectives. We combine deterministic data and advanced processing techniques to continuously train these algorithms as they optimize our clients’ key performance indicators (KPIs), predicting consumer behavior in order to autonomously drive full-funnel marketing performance at scale.

Applied Science and Analytics at Cognitiv is a highly visible team at the center of our products. We are looking for a Senior Data Science Analyst (or Lead depending on experience) with experience in AdTech who can work cross functionally across Science, Engineering, and Commercial teams to help Cognitiv generate actionable insights that will help improve our programmatic campaigns. Your day-to-day responsibilities can performing statistical testing, designing and testing of experiments, in-depth analysis to optimize models and campaigns, and generate insights for internal stakeholders as well as externally for clients. You should be comfortable analyzing, interpreting, and communicating results to upper management.

Data Science Analysts use SQL-like languages to query data sets with billions and sometimes trillions of rows. A good understanding of SQL and query efficiency is essential for this role. Previous experience with big data is a plus. You should be comfortable with visualization tools like Tableau, creating derived tables, setting up experiments in AB tests, setting up automated data pipelines, and performing statistical testing using multiple methods (z-test, t-test, chi-squared test, etc)

We value in-person collaboration with team members and have a hybrid work schedule. This position will be located in our Bellevue, WA office with 3 days in office (Mon/Tue/Wed) and 2 days remote (Thursday/Friday).
Responsibilities
Analyze large data sets to find patterns and actionable insights to help address performance issues and identify drivers of performance for campaigns
Collaborate with cross-functional partners to understand business needs and prioritize tasks accordingly
Monitor system performance and success metrics across our systems
Deliver effective presentations of findings to multiple levels of leadership, creating easy to interpret visual displays of quantitative data
Build, monitor, and maintain dashboards and data pipelines
Help architect, plan, and implement how our team should approach analyzing marketing performance for new and existing products
Comfortable managing multiple priorities, communicating campaign performance and project progress to management
Requirements
BS or BA in a quantitative field
5+ years of experience using analytics to drive significant business impact
Advanced proficiency with SQL query optimization and expertise in working with complex data sets
Big data experience with log files and large data sets
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Demonstrated ability to communicate results of analyses to technical and business audiences
Experienced in statistical testing and methods, experimentation, and predictive analytics
Proficiency working with at least one scripting language such as Python
Tableau or similar business intelligence software experience
Superior communication and collaboration skills
Experience with online marketing analytics
Preferred Qualifications
Advanced degree in analytics or a technical field
Basic understanding of machine learning
Understanding of distributed SQL technologies
Salary
$130,000-$180,000 base salary DOE + equity

Actual compensation is based on multiple factors that are unique to each candidate, including and not limited to job-related knowledge, level of relevant experience, education and skills. Base salary is just one component of your total rewards package at Cognitiv. Employees are eligible for equity and various benefits.
Here are some of the many benefits that our employees receive:
Medical, Dental and Vision coverage, including some plans that are 100% employer paid
12 weeks paid parental leave
Unlimited PTO
Hybrid work model
Lunch reimbursement
Fitness reimbursement
Cell phone reimbursement
401(k) plan
Employee Assistance Program
Pre-tax commuter benefits

Cognitiv has been revolutionizing the ad tech space for the last 7 years as the only programmatic buying platform to leverage Deep Learning in real-time. We use Deep Learning (the most sophisticated machine learning) to build custom algorithms for digital marketers to help grow their customer base. We have seen explosive growth and are looking for talented people who are looking to affect change in a rapidly growing organization and industry to join the team.

Cognitiv is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under federal, state, or local law.",Not Applicable,Full-time,Information Technology,"Transportation, Logistics, Supply Chain and Storage",https://www.linkedin.com/jobs/view/senior-or-lead-data-science-analyst-at-cognitiv-3673575546?refId=60lfSzlUTb6XV%2FxLmBxhSg%3D%3D&trackingId=yneBXXU1Bc8LF%2Bv2q4X5RA%3D%3D&position=17&pageNum=37&trk=public_jobs_jserp-result_search-card

column1: 2023-07-08,Capleo Global,IN - IDOH Data Analyst,"Edison, NJ","Short Description
The BRFSS Analyst position, within the Office of Data and Analytics (ODA), validates, cleans, and analyzes the Indiana BRFSS dataset in order to garner public health insight.
Complete Description
Purpose of Position/Summary:

The BRFSS Analyst position, within the Office of Data and Analytics (ODA), validates, cleans, and analyzes the Indiana BRFSS dataset in order to garner public health insight. Working independently, with some guidance from senior staff, the incumbent conducts general data analysis, contributes to complex data analysis, completes data quality checks, builds visualization and reports, presents key findings, and provides guidance and review for BRFSS data analysis intern projects. This role serves a subject matter expert for the analysis of BRFSS data at IDOH.
Essential Duties/Responsibilities
Serves as project lead/subject matter expert for the analysis of BRFSS data at IDOH.
Conducts general analysis of BRFSS data
column2: serves as project lead for analyses utilizing BRFSS data, as assigned.

column1: Contributes to complex analysis of BRFSS data, as requested
Collaborates with internal and external partners to develop novel ways of using and reporting out surveillance data on health outcomes.
Develops effective reports to communicate findings with target audience(s)
Develops compelling data visualizations to communicate findings, including Tableau dashboards
Presents key findings and summaries of results to internal and external stakeholders
Cleans and validates BRFSS data with minimal guidance
Conducts data quality checks to ensure the validity and cleanliness of BRFSS data prior to use in analysis and reporting
Adheres to HIPAA and other state statutes concerned with protecting data confidentiality and individual privacy

Supports IDOH Data Transformation Office activities, as requested.",Entry level,Full-time,Information Technology,Staffing and Recruiting,https://www.linkedin.com/jobs/view/in-idoh-data-analyst-at-capleo-global-3657198868?refId=60lfSzlUTb6XV%2FxLmBxhSg%3D%3D&trackingId=zUaK00cjUxdCJ7m4yUW2RQ%3D%3D&position=20&pageNum=37&trk=public_jobs_jserp-result_search-card

column1: 2023-08-05,Cardinal Health,"Sr. Data Analyst, Data Analytics","Kentucky, United States","What Data Analytics brings to Cardinal Health:

The Data & Analytics Function oversees the analytics life-cycle in order to identify, analyze and present relevant insights that drive business decisions and anticipate opportunities to achieve a competitive advantage. Job Description

We are seeking a talented SQL Developer to join our team and contribute to the development and maintenance of our data infrastructure. As an SQL Developer, you will play a crucial role in designing, implementing, and optimizing database solutions, enabling efficient data storage, retrieval, and manipulation. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data requirements and deliver effective solutions that meet our clients' needs. This is a unique opportunity to work on diverse projects, tackle complex data challenges, and make a significant impact in the world of data.
Responsibilities
Collaborate with stakeholders to gather data requirements and translate them into efficient SQL queries, stored procedures, and functions.
Design, develop, and maintain database schemas, ensuring data integrity, security, and performance.
Write complex SQL queries for data extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL) processes.
Optimize SQL queries and database performance, identifying and resolving bottlenecks and inefficiencies.
Develop data validation and quality assurance processes to ensure accuracy and reliability.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate SQL code into applications and reporting systems.
Conduct data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and insights that drive business decisions.
Stay up-to-date with the latest trends and advancements in SQL and database technologies.
Requirements
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.
Proven experience as an SQL Developer or Database Developer, working with complex databases.
Strong proficiency in SQL and experience with relational databases (e.g., MySQL, Oracle, SQL Server).
Solid understanding of database design principles, data modeling, and normalization.
Proficiency in writing complex SQL queries, stored procedures, and functions.
Experience with performance optimization and tuning of SQL queries and database indexing.
Familiarity with ETL processes and tools (e.g., SSIS, Informatica) is a plus.
Knowledge of data warehousing concepts and dimensional modeling is desirable.
Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to analyze complex data requirements.
Excellent attention to detail and a commitment to delivering high-quality solutions.
Effective communication and collaboration skills to work with cross-functional teams.
Special Benefits You Will Love

2023-07-13,Texas Health and Human Services,Data and Tech Analyst,"Austin, TX","Job Description
Management Analyst III (Data and Tech Analyst)

The Records Management Group (RMG) protects, provides, and preserves the records of the Texas Department of Family and Protective Services. In order to support this mission, the RMG Management Analyst III (MA), functional title Data and Tech Analyst, performs advanced consultative work by designing and conducting complex analysis of operational data and agency functions for management to support decision making and implementation of goals and initiatives. The position will be responsible for analyzing and reporting on data produced. This position will advise and consult with the RMG management team to identify priorities and gaps in service and quality delivery.

Additionally, this position will serve as the liaison for RMG with internal and external entities, stakeholders, subject matter experts, and information technology department to identify business requirements and coordinate the automation of new or improved existing systems to enhance business operations.

The position reports to RMG’s State Office Manager and maintains day-to-day communication and coordination with division managers and supervisors. May supervise the work of others. Work is performed under minimal supervision with considerable latitude for the use of initiative and independent judgment.
Essential Job Functions
Attends work on a regular and predictable schedule in accordance with agency leave policy and performs other duties as assigned.

Coordinates the design, planning and implementation of RMG program organizational studies, program policies, procedures and issues, and develops recommendations, solutions and best practices. Identifies critical RMG program policy and organizational issues and conducts research and analysis of complex program concerns. Defines the purpose, scope, goals, objectives and requirements of studies and analyses. Evaluates results or survey data, and develops changes for RMG program policies, protocols and procedures. Evaluates historical, current, and projected data regarding demands from stakeholders (Members of the Legislature, District Court Judges, District/County Attorneys, Law Enforcement, DFPS Program Staff) to identify trends, patterns and issues, and develops reports and recommendations. Provides in-depth data analyses to drive evidence-based changes to RMG policies, procedures, strategic planning and training modules. Provides advice, consultation and program data analysis and interpretation to management and staff. Serves as the liaison for RMG with internal and external entities, stakeholders, subject matter experts, and information technology department to provide RMG program technical guidance and data. Participates in RMG program strategic planning activities by providing data-supported recommendations. (20%)

Provides technical expertise regarding RMG policies, project management, procedures, regulations, rules, and guidelines. Coordinates the development and analysis of data designed to inform RMG policies and procedures. Analyzes current and proposed legislation affecting the RMG program and assesses potential or actual program impact using a data-driven approach and assesses impact to the RMG program. Provides consultation, guidance, and quality assurance review to the RMG program and agency staff regarding policies, guidelines and state and federal legislative changes and updates. Conducts periodic, extensive analyses to evaluate organizational and administrative effects of changes to the RMG program and develops reports of findings and recommendations. (20%)

Coordinates, plans, and directs the development and maintenance of RMG’s program databases. Provides guidance and consultation to designated information technology (IT) staff regarding RMG program business and data requirements to facilitate development and maintenance of the RMG program databases designed to collect, maintain, and generate data and reports. Develops and defines the program’s requirements regarding data repository range, functionality, use, and manages data submission, extraction, reporting and maintenance. Generates comprehensive statistical analyses, and develops ad-hoc, custom and recurring division reports and disseminates as appropriate. Generates and analyzes information from the database to support ongoing refinement of RMG program policies, procedures, work methods and approaches, training, and standard agency records protocols. Tracks data, incidents, reports and system issues, and performs testing to validate the integrity of database information and data. (20%)

Designs and develops performance measurement, risk assessment and decision-making methods and tools. Drives the development of process flows and redesigns using a data-driven approach. Performs risk assessments and impact analyses of proposed changes to RMG program systems and business processes. Manages studies and projects including issue escalation, change management processes, and addressing concerns raised in quality reviews with stakeholders and internal and external business partners. Facilitates meetings with agency programs to collect input regarding RMG policies, strategies, tools and resources, protocols, and issues. Conducts analyses to prioritize policy and procedure changes to its operations as part of its strategic, operational, and business planning processes. (20%)

Develops communications regarding RMG program policy changes and newly developed policies and procedures. Designs, develops, and coordinates review and dissemination of RMG program periodic program reporting requirements. Develops guidance regarding design, execution and communication regarding RMG program policies and projects for program management and agency management. Collaborates with RMG program stakeholders and agency and program staff to ensure timely and accurate communications. Develops informational materials and communications using a variety of computer software programs. Develops and delivers training regarding RMG programs, resources, and strategies. Represents the RMG Division at meetings, conferences, committees, seminars, and workgroups. (20%)
Knowledge Skills Abilities
Knowledge of organizational development and management practices as applied to the analysis, evaluation, development, and implementation of programs, policies, and procedures.
Knowledge of basic principles of Business Analysis and Project Management.
Skill in administrative organization, project planning, assignment tracking, implementation processes, and status reporting.
Skill in effective verbal and written communication, including proofreading, developing presentations and report writing.
Skill in organization and management of multiple tasks and projects.
Skill in analyzing and interpreting data and creating data visualizations and summaries for an executive audience (Excel, and/or Tableau, or similar).
Skill in analyzing business needs and developing requirements for solutions.

Ability to evaluate problems, to develop alternative solutions, to develop and implement policies and procedures, to design and deliver training, to prepare concise reports, and to communicate effectively.
Ability to leverage data in the development of solutions, policies, procedures, training, and communication.
Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships in order to gain and keep a high level of trust, confidence, and respect.
Ability to establish, define, and set priorities.
Ability to balance change and continuity, to adjust and respond to changing job priorities, and continually strive to improve customer service within the framework of state government.
Ability to plan, assign, and supervise the work of others.
Ability to gather, assemble, correlate, and analyze facts.
Gathers, analyzes, and documents user requirements, business processes, and problems to automate and improve existing systems
column2: elicit and documents business needs for new systems.

column1: May supervise the work of others.
Performs related work as assigned.
Registration Or Licensure Requirements
Business Process Analysis certification preferred, but not required.
Initial Selection Criteria

Experience in methods analysis, management, or organizational development work. Graduation from an accredited four-year college or university with major coursework in business administration or a related field is generally preferred. Experience and education may be substituted for one another.

At least three years of progressively increasing responsibility and professional experience with policy and procedures interpretation and development, services, project management, and administration.
Three years or more of Business Process Analysis or Information Technology experience.
Additional Information
DFPS experience preferred, but not required.

This position may be housed in Austin, El Paso, Dallas, Houston, or San Antonio. Regardless of location, the best candidate will be selected. The position is full-time teleworking, however, will require 15% travel to attend in-person meetings, conferences, etc.

Job Description

Our client, a large defense contractor, has an immediate opening for a Staff Data Analyst to work from their Sterling Heights, MI facility. We are seeking a motivated Data Scientist to support the our client's Reliability Analytics team in support of developing tools and analysis of our client's vehicle performance degrading drivers.

We are looking for an individual who has deep data analytics skills, thinks strategically, works pragmatically in a dynamic environment with few guardrails, and enjoys getting stuff done. In this role, you will need strong customer empathy and an ability to focus on Reliability, Logistics and Engineering priorities. This position will interface directly with both internal and external customers at all levels.

The selected candidate will function as a data scientist supporting a team through the development of machine learning algorithms and automated tooling. Candidate will also aid in the development and maintenance of user interfaces with predictive analytics capabilities. The successful candidate will research, develop, validate, and document complex data relationships in a data warehouse environment. The candidate will utilize all parts of the data analysis pipeline, such as data collection, cleaning, analysis, visualization, and presentation to deliver critical insights to internal and external customers.
Additional Responsibilities Include
Develop statistical and machine learning models for predicting and forecasting field failures.
Use predictive modeling to optimize customer supportability requirements and manufacturing revenue generation.
Develop business matrices and dashboards that portray the data and models to someone with a minimum technical background.
Work cross-functionally with the cloud data infrastructure, IT, and other data stakeholders to drive implementation of data interfaces.

Develop strong partnerships with design, service, manufacturing, testing and other engineering teams across the organization to promote a data driven mindset in decision making around product development, design improvements, and servicing strategies.
Position Requirements
Minimum requirement is a Bachelor's degree in one of following: Mathematics, Computer Science, Information Science, Statistics, Data Analytics or an Engineering discipline.
Experience SQL or any querying language, Data Analytics, Data Science, Data Engineering Technologies, ETL
5 - 7 years experience of professional experience

2023-07-15,Dobbs Defense Solutions,Statistician,"Bethesda, MD","Our Mission

At Dobbs Defense, we deliver mission-centric IT, Cyber, and data analytics solutions for our government and commercial clients through the convergence of automation, innovation, training, and education. Delivering high-quality IT, cybersecurity, and data analytics solutions through proven and innovative methods is our vision.
Job Description

Dobbs Defense Solutions is seeking a highly capable Statistician to analyze quantitative data to improve our client competitiveness. Your duties will include gathering numerical data, performing statistical analyses on data, and preparing industry outlooks and forecasts.

To ensure success, statisticians should exhibit extensive experience in performing statistical analyses and possess the ability to interpret results effectively. Accomplished statisticians provide businesses with a competitive edge by accurately predicting industry trends.
Duties
This position serves as a statistician with responsibility to design, approve, and monitor statistical studies involving surveys and health workforce supply and demand projections.

Provides advice and is responsible for contributing to the design of complex national health workforce and policy issues related to health professions surveys, including sample design, data collection methods, instrument content and design, data processing protocols, editing and imputation procedures, weighting and estimation methods, quality assurance, and management of data collection.
Consults on the application of advanced statistical analysis theory and methodology, including the most current advances.

Collaborates with policy analysts, researchers, and other officials within the Office, in other components of the Agency, in other agencies of Federal, State, and local governments, and in other organizations.

Develops and implements sample and instrument designs for surveys collecting data related to the health professions, utilizing the appropriate survey design theory and methods, effectively using the assigned budget, plans efficient use of available resources in implementing new sample designs, field procedures, questionnaires, and quality control systems.

Utilizing secondary data to write a clear research question, select a study sample, utilize appropriate measurement, and sample weighting techniques and design a thoughtful analytic approach to answer high impact questions on health workforce issues.

Develops studies of health professions programs, utilizing the appropriate statistical and epidemiologic theory and methods, effectively using the assigned budget, and considering precision criteria and the existence of non-sampling errors.
Develops statistical analyses to produce unbiased population estimates and estimates of variances from complex sample designs.
The analytic and technical skills to make sound judgments that balance quality and cost/performance factors, with appropriate consideration of the consequences of such decisions.

Evaluates health professions/workforce data from various sources and makes recommendations regarding technical policy in terms of limitations, validity, interpretation, release of data and usefulness of the data source as a tool in addressing health professions/workforce policy issues.
Qualifications
Required education and experience:
Master's degree in statistics, data science, mathematics, or equivalent master's degree program with a focus on statistical methods.
Post-Secondary qualification in business management, or equivalent experience in a related industry.
5 years of experience working as a statistician, or in a similar role.
Proficiency in statistical software programs, including SPSS and R, or equivalent.
Advanced knowledge of statistical methods, techniques, formulas, and tests.
Exceptional ability to interpret data and analyze trends, as well as preparing industry outlooks and forecasts.
Advanced business operation and industry knowledge.
Ability to liaise with other departments to coordinate data gathering.
Extensive experience in summarizing and presenting findings in reports.
Keen attention to detail and excellent recordkeeping skills.

Additionally, experience with communication and collaboration with stakeholders across multifaceted organizations, identifying opportunities, communicating findings, and delivering actionable insights.
Required Clearance
None
Working Environment
Remote

2023-07-24,"University of California, San Francisco",Research Assistant and Data Analyst,"San Francisco, CA","Division of Prevention Science (DPS)
Full Time
Job Summary

This Research Assistant and Data Analyst will support a randomized controlled trial about the provision of guaranteed income (GI) and additional financial supports for low-income Black young adults (age 18-24) in San Francisco and Oakland. Envisioning a more equitable and healthy future requires bold interventions to address poverty, racism, the chronic stress built from poverty and racism, and the fundamental impacts on health. GI represents not only an opportunity to provide for basic needs while youth finish schooling or training programs, but also helps set a course for establishing a career at a critical time in development. Specifically, this trial will evaluate the impacts of GI, financial coaching, and peer learning circles on participants' investment in their future (education, employment training), mental health (depressive symptoms and anxiety), and unmet mental health and sexual/reproductive health service needs.
The employee will apply their knowledge and skills to support study implementation, including: collecting and entering data
column2: contributing to data collection instruments and methods
column3: perform quality control and data cleaning
column4: produce descriptive statistics
column5: assist with study tool development and programming in REDCap
column6: and engaging and retaining participants during the two-year follow-up period. The employee will work closely with the study team, under the supervision of the Project Director, to ensure smooth study implementation, contribute to rigorous data collection and analysis, address and resolve any operational challenges, and maintain strong participant communication and retention over the course of the study.

Department Description

The Division of Prevention Science (DPS) is based at the Mission Bay campus at 550 16th Street. The division was established within the Department of Medicine in 1991 and is the administrative home of the Center for AIDS Prevention Studies (CAPS), the Prevention Research Center (PRC), the Center of Excellence for Transgender Health (CoE), and the Research Coordinating Center to Reduce Disparities in Multiple Chronic Diseases (RCC). The division’s research focus is risk behavior and reduction
column2: epidemiology of the virus
column3: evaluation of HIV testing procedures, demographic variables and sexual self-identification
column4: and training for providers who care for HIV AIDS patients. The division is comprised of approximately 45 academics (faculty, specialists, postdocs, and visiting professors) and 55 non-academic staff.

About UCSF

The University of California, San Francisco (UCSF) is a leading university dedicated to promoting health worldwide through advanced biomedical research, graduate-level education in the life sciences and health professions, and excellence in patient care. It is the only campus in the 10-campus UC system dedicated exclusively to the health sciences. We bring together the world’s leading experts in nearly every area of health. We are home to five Nobel laureates who have advanced the understanding of cancer, neurodegenerative diseases, aging and stem cells.
Pride Values

UCSF is a diverse community made of people with many skills and talents. We seek candidates whose work experience or community service has prepared them to contribute to our commitment to professionalism, respect, integrity, diversity and excellence – also known as our PRIDE values.

In addition to our PRIDE values, UCSF is committed to equity – both in how we deliver care as well as our workforce. We are committed to building a broadly diverse community, nurturing a culture that is welcoming and supportive, and engaging diverse ideas for the provision of culturally competent education, discovery, and patient care. We are seeking an experienced OSINT (Open Source Intelligence) Collections Specialist and Analyst to join our team at Arrow Security. The successful candidate will possess strong analytical capabilities and a deep understanding of open-source intelligence-gathering techniques. This role will involve leveraging OSINT to understand and interpret the competitive landscape, identifying opportunities, and predicting industry trends to position Arrow Security for future success.
WHY SHOULD YOU CONSIDER WORKING AT ARROW SECURITY?

Wouldn't you like to be part of an organization that respects and values all of its people? Where each person can make a difference and be heard because every person's role in the organization is important? At Arrow Security, we challenge our people in a beneficial way to grow both personally and professionally. We strive to offer the best compensation, benefits, flexibility and unique perks possible while promoting a positive work life balance. At Arrow, we understand how important this is to our people. column2: We offer an enjoyable and collaborative culture with great communication and respect in a safe workplace. At Arrow Security, ""We Care"" is our Motto. And we make sure to take care of the people who take care of our clients.

WE PAY ON A WEEKLY BASIS

Essential Job Responsibilities
Intelligence Collection: Gather, validate, and analyze open-source intelligence data to create detailed and actionable reports.
Competitive Analysis: Conduct an in-depth analysis of the competitive environment in both current and prospective markets to identify key trends, opportunities, and threats.
Threat Assessment: Use OSINT methods to gain insight into the threat environment in current and expansion areas, helping to inform our security strategies and risk management approaches.
Trend Identification: Monitor and analyze industry trends to inform service development and strategic planning processes.
Market Opportunities: Use intelligence analysis to identify potential opportunities for growth and expansion in the security industry.
Reporting: Deliver clear, concise, and actionable intelligence reports to senior management and relevant teams.

column1: 2023-07-17,Get It Recruit - Information Technology,Data Governance Analyst - Remote | WFH,"Arlington, VA","Are you passionate about leveraging the power of data to drive meaningful improvements in clinical and operational performance? Do you thrive in an environment that values innovation and collaboration? If you're an experienced Data Governance Analyst looking for a new and dynamic challenge, we have the perfect opportunity for you!

We are a leading organization on the cutting edge of data analytics, and we're seeking a talented Data Governance Analyst to join our team. This position offers a unique hybrid work model, combining the convenience of remote work with the camaraderie of on-site collaboration. You'll spend 2 days a week in our vibrant Arlington, VA office and enjoy the flexibility of 3 remote days.
Why Join Us?
Make an Impact: You'll play a pivotal role in providing data-driven insights that directly impact clinicians and customers, contributing to tangible performance improvement.
Innovation and Growth: Join a team that embraces innovation and encourages personal and professional growth.
Work-Life Balance: We value work-life balance and believe in empowering our employees to thrive both in and out of the workplace.
Competitive Salary: Enjoy a competitive salary ranging from $120,000 to $140,000 per year.
Key Responsibilities
As our Data Governance Analyst, you will be at the forefront of driving data excellence and creating transformative data-driven solutions. Your responsibilities will include:
Collaborating with customers to gather and document data requirements, ensuring we meet their specific needs effectively.
Producing and developing insightful reports, dashboards, and interactive visuals from diverse data sources, utilizing your analytical prowess and query expertise.
Validating and analyzing output and metrics to ensure data quality, reliability, and integrity, ensuring we maintain the highest standards.
Creating comprehensive technical documentation, including source-to-target mappings, methodologies, and output requirements, to ensure seamless continuity and knowledge sharing.
Interpreting data and deliverables, presenting findings in engaging formats such as charts, graphs, and tables.
Desired Qualifications
To thrive in this role, you should possess the following qualifications:
Approximately 6 years of experience in the field of Data Governance, showcasing your expertise in handling complex database analytics and reporting.
Strong analytical skills, with the ability to translate data into actionable insights and recommendations.
Proficiency in querying data from various sources and generating meaningful output that empowers decision-making.
Detail-oriented approach, ensuring data accuracy and reliability at all stages of analysis.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills, enabling you to work effectively with cross-functional teams and customers.

Don't miss this opportunity to be part of a forward-thinking team that values your expertise and fosters a supportive and innovative work culture. Apply now to take the next exciting step in your career journey!
